commit_message:
a little refactoring

 * running verify_networks after every deployment
 * running ostf after every deployment
 * cleanup for some overheads(like using already obtained cluster_id)

Change-Id: I9790140f12bf849f956da005ca81416a6816d1fe

_supports_direct_io is helper method which does try block to boolean conversion.
 
The method functionality closely related to the specific operating system and file-system behavior, not too much to test without a real system.

The new os.write raises the same exception on alignment error as the open when the direct i/o is not supported at all.

_supports_direct_io is tested with both and True and False return value, 

IMHO Creating a new stub for raising the same errno.EINVAL from the same try block does not provides any additional value.'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-12-05 14:10:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-05 15:01:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-05 13:02:27.000000000', 'message': 'Consider minimal I/O size when selecting cache type

The "none" cache type is not usable when a file-system
has stricter alignment requirements, for example the
xfs file-system created with 4k sector size,
requires all DIRECT I/O request is aligned to 4k.

qemu assumes direct I/O is doable with 512 byte alignment.

_supports_direct_io method will attempt to write exactly 512 byte,
in-order to ensure the underlying file-system is qemu cache=none
compatible.

Change-Id: I5e1ba4e8afa87519cb0ed1120c213f7c318ccef2
'}, {'created': '2013-12-05 14:10:41.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: consider minimal I/O size when selecting cache type

The "none" cache type is not usable when a file-system
has stricter alignment requirements, for example the
xfs file-system created with 4k sector size,
requires all DIRECT I/O request is aligned to 4k.

qemu assumes direct I/O is doable with 512 byte alignment.

_supports_direct_io method will attempt to write exactly 512 byte,
in-order to ensure the underlying file-system is qemu cache=none
compatible.

Change-Id: I5e1ba4e8afa87519cb0ed1120c213f7c318ccef2
'}, {'created': '2013-12-05 22:12:45.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: consider minimal I/O size when selecting cache type

The "none" cache type is not usable when a file-system
has stricter alignment and minimal I/O size requirements,
for example the xfs file-system created with 4kiB sector size,
requires all DIRECT I/O operation has to be done with
 integer multiple of 4 kiB count/size.

qemu assumes direct I/O is doable with 512 byte minimal size,
so the  _supports_direct_io method needs to check is
the direct I/O doable with 512 byte size.

Change-Id: I5e1ba4e8afa87519cb0ed1120c213f7c318ccef2
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: consider minimal I/O size when selecting cache type

The "none" cache type is not usable when a file-system
has stricter alignment and minimal I/O size requirements,
for example the xfs file-system created with 4kiB sector size,
requires all DIRECT I/O operation has to be done with
 integer multiple of 4 kiB count/size.

qemu assumes direct I/O is doable with 512 byte minimal size,
so the  _supports_direct_io method needs to check is
the direct I/O doable with 512 byte size.

Change-Id: I5e1ba4e8afa87519cb0ed1120c213f7c318ccef2

commit_message:
Replace xrange in for loop with range

xrange is not supported in python 3, so replace it with six.moves.range

Closes-Bug: #1259978

Change-Id: I321380693d45f7d48f52da2d0f8e4c137763ab0c

commit_message:
Add negative tests for network

Create a base class for negative and positive network tests
Add some negative tests for network

- test_update_non_existent_network
- test_delete_non_existent_network

Blueprint negative-test-files

Change-Id: Ib7df4f4ee40a0b4bf43bffa8fe123c321b0b2d9e

commit_message:
Various fixes related to end-to-end testing

* Fixed several problems in scalable engine
* Fixed engine interface
* Fixed several problems in REST API
* Changed task DB model
* Fixed DSL parser
* Added scripts for end-to-end testing

Change-Id: Icbcc46d11a6c687d0ae3aad339ca5f5134c50195

'}, {'account_id': 7763, 'date': '2013-12-18 16:36:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Question: I don't see a "set_notifier_func(group_id, notifier)" implementation. Is there any way for some serivce to be notified when group membership will change?

In addition I guess we'll need some kind of a heartbeat call to confirm that group member is still online (this can be done using "update_capabilities" call but I think it deserves a separate method)'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2013-12-18 19:06:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 23:

Alexi I think those are valid things to have, but seem like an initial first commit doesn't need to be fully complete. I was thinking those could be added after this commit (since I believe they are useful also)."}, {'account_id': 7763, 'date': '2013-12-18 19:59:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 23: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Agreed. I'm just thinking that you could split commit into 2 commits:

1) Define complete interface of coordinator

2) Add ZooKeeper implementation

It would be much easier to review it separately."}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2013-12-18 20:05:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 23:

I think its a good idea, but first commit or second commit doesn't need to be 100% defined in what everything will be, software is an iterative process after all. I wish it was possible to make perfect interfaces from step 0 :-)"}, {'account_id': 7450, 'date': '2013-12-19 11:29:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23: (3 inline comments)

Thanks for your comment :-),

@Alexei: The notification system will be added until we have an other backend, like Memcached, in order
to be more confident with the API, in addition this part wil be hard to implement in such database...

What do you mean by "heartbeat call" ? In the Zookeeper backend, group membership is established by using ephemeral znodes, in this mode the client will send heartbeats and if it fails its znode will be automatically removed by the ZK server. In other backends, i think we will dedicate a thread which send heartbeats to the database. Does it answer to your question ?

You are right for the two commits, i will take your remark in consideration in next commits.

Thanks !'}, {'account_id': 7450, 'date': '2013-12-19 11:29:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 24.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-19 11:30:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-06 12:57:02.000000000', 'message': 'First commit of Tooz

For now the project is composed of a simple API and
use ZooKeeper as the first backend.

Created files:
    - tooz/api.py: the python public API and the abstract class
to implement for backends.

    - tooz/drivers/zookeeper.py: the ZooKeeper backend using the
Kazoo client.

    - tooz/exceptions.py: additional exception will be defined here.

    - tooz/models.py: read only classes, for now the Member class.

    - tooz/tests/test_api.py: Tooz will provide a unique unit-tests suite
which will be run against all backends (thanks to testscenarios).

Change-Id: I4e4cefb52cf6c39a3f6ba35ab1d4ef34a77b5811
'}, {'created': '2013-12-09 11:20:05.000000000', 'message': 'First commit of Tooz

For now the project is composed of a simple API and
use ZooKeeper as the first backend.

Created files:
    - tooz/api.py: the python public API and the abstract class
to implement for backends.

    - tooz/drivers/zookeeper.py: the ZooKeeper backend using the
Kazoo client.

    - tooz/exceptions.py: additional exception will be defined here.

    - tooz/models.py: read only classes, for now the Member class.

    - tooz/tests/test_api.py: Tooz will provide a unique unit-tests suite
which will be run against all backends (thanks to testscenarios).

Change-Id: I4e4cefb52cf6c39a3f6ba35ab1d4ef34a77b5811
'}, {'created': '2013-12-09 14:13:23.000000000', 'message': "First commit of Tooz

For now Tooz is composed of a simple API and use ZooKeeper
as the first backend.

The current API provide the group membership protocol like
'servicegroup' in Nova, we enriched it by adding the notion
of capabilities. The notification mechanism is not yet
available. Please read the associated blueprint for more details:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Oslo/blueprints/service-sync

All new backends must implement api.CoordinationDriver and
validate the unit tests. Tooz will provide a unique unit-tests suite
which will be run against all backends.

Change-Id: I4e4cefb52cf6c39a3f6ba35ab1d4ef34a77b5811
"}, {'created': '2013-12-10 16:54:34.000000000', 'message': "First commit of Tooz

For now Tooz is composed of a simple API and use ZooKeeper
as the first backend.

The current API provide the group membership protocol like
'servicegroup' in Nova, we enriched it by adding the notion
of capabilities. The notification mechanism is not yet
available. Please read the associated blueprint for more details:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Oslo/blueprints/service-sync

All new backends must implement api.CoordinationDriver and

commit_message:
First commit of Tooz

For now Tooz is composed of a simple API and use ZooKeeper
as the first backend.

The current API provide the group membership protocol like
'servicegroup' in Nova, we enriched it by adding the notion
of capabilities. The API is currently synchronous, we plan to
design an asynchronous one. The notification mechanism is not yet
available. Please read the associated blueprint for more details:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Oslo/blueprints/service-sync

All new backends must implement api.CoordinationDriver and
validate the unit tests. Tooz will provide a unique unit-tests suite
which will be run against all backends.

Change-Id: I4e4cefb52cf6c39a3f6ba35ab1d4ef34a77b5811

So I don't think now is good time for changing it, because many reviewers are knowing this process."}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-12-05 19:44:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(6 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-12-05 20:50:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The issues pointed out by lifeless exist all over tempest, particularly with resource leaks on test failures. If we really want to make sure no resources are leaked in the presence of failures I believe we would have to take an approach that was more gc-like rather than trying to stick in addCleanUp wherever something could possibly leak. That would mean never doing a resource allocation by a direct client call, but rather by going through a method in a base test class that tracks the resource and deletes during test cleanup. In the small number of cases that doing this would cause too much to be allocated, a test could free manually.

We already do this in a number of places such as the BaseCompute, BaseImage, BaseNetwork. 

It would be reasonable to fix these things in this file before cloning but I would not insist on it.'}, {'account_id': 5586, 'date': '2013-12-07 12:34:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

hi. David Kranz

Thanks for your suggestion. 
But I think I havn't caught the point. If we track the resource in BaseCompute,compared with addCleanup, we just put the cleanup in TearDownClass rather than TearDown. What is the difference between TearDownClass and TearDown here? Why can it make sure no resources are leaked in the presence of failures?
Could you explain more about this?"}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-12-08 18:17:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Ivan: What I was saying is not a difference between "cleanup after test method" vs. "cleanup after test class". It was whether a test writer has to decide whether and where to insert an addCleanUp call for each resource allocated. The easiest way to do this is to never call self.client.allocate_some_resource() but to call self.allocate_some_resource() where the method on self calls the client method and adds the resource to a list to be deleted. If we did that then it would not be necessary to put in addCleanUp for most cases. An example of this is the create_test_server on the BaseComputeTest class. Of course it would be a lot of work to change all the code to do this and nested resources like security-group rules are a bit more complicated but I think it would be a good direction to go.'}, {'account_id': 5586, 'date': '2013-12-09 08:22:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

hi, David Kranz
thanks for your explain. I got it. Yes, maybe it's a better code style. But I think we can do that in another patch, all maybe need more discussion."}, {'account_id': 5586, 'date': '2013-12-09 08:27:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

hi lifeless
thanks for your review. I will apply your suggestion in the part2 patch.'}, {'account_id': 5586, 'date': '2013-12-09 08:40:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

hi David Kranz
can we just track these resource in the tests class, rather than the base one? It is more flexible, and easier to do.'}, {'account_id': 5586, 'date': '2013-12-09 09:05:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-12-09 09:05:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Automatically re-added by Gerrit trivial rebase detection script."}, {'account_id': 5586, 'date': '2013-12-09 09:13:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-12-09 09:13:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
port test_keypairs into nova v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. This is being tried in order to make
reviewing of the porting easier as gerrit will display only what
is actually changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api-tests

Change-Id: I1f49bb12cb193bfa7db069f392f845838d6f8cc4

commit_message:
Add test_discover module to provide a load_tests hook

This commit adds a load_tests hook that will be used to discover the
set of tempest tests that excludes the unit tests. We can't just
discover from the tempest topdir like we previously did because of
mutually exclusive requirements between the normal tempest tests and
the unit tests. (for example mox and mock should not be required for
a tempest run)

Change-Id: I562f033d78e654675fd77af3bf64c44945127bd7

Fixed minor notes in patch-set: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/56235/14

commit_message:
Renamed tox virtualenv for UI tests

Renamed tox virtualenv for UI tests from 'tests'(incorrect name for tox plug-in) to 'uitests'
Fixed minor notes in patch-set: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/56235/14

Change-Id: If29d598e05c6ec6b957103d524b429d5cb97e812

commit_message:
Adjust murano simple test service-list check

As we deploy murano with neutron instead of nova-network
there should be no check for nova-network in service-list
output.

Change-Id: I1436362feac225d6ff4f1076e83ef5a85bf2abef

commit_message:
Add nested resource references to resource group

Originally, there was no way to get references to the
resources inside the resource group. This prevented
things like attaching volumes to instances in the group.
This patch allows both aggregated as well as indexed
access to ref id's of the nested resources.

Closes-Bug: #1259830
Change-Id: Id13eb6edd91bfc34d8bab05f429e761fe89ed799

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-15 23:16:25.000000000', 'message': 'Allow updating empty created v2 images from v1

When an image is created empty with v2 its size is None.
This behavior was causing v1 to fail when trying to update the image since
it expects an integer - in this case 0.

Change-Id: I8322d012b2ed15cf3fed769776c20b6489f8e9a0
Closes-bug: #1258160
'}]
commit_message:
Allow updating empty created v2 images from v1

When an image is created empty with v2 its size is None.
This behavior was causing v1 to fail when trying to update the image since
it expects an integer - in this case 0.

Change-Id: I8322d012b2ed15cf3fed769776c20b6489f8e9a0
Closes-bug: #1258160

configure-vm: refactor template formatting

Collapse the three copies of the bare metal NIC template and use the
same dict declaration style used earlier in the script.

Change-Id: I0263d7a3c35cf3ee208012539dddd5176f5dbc7a

commit_message:
Add ovsbridge option to configure-vm

Adds a --ovsbridge for seed VMs. This will cause the public
interface on the seed to be placed on a ovs bridge as an
alternative to the default libvirt network.

Change-Id: Ia19d25087f9b8b21d9ff9da3a41b7a6131b081d9

commit_message:
Drop dependency on lockutils from oslo db code

While lockutils is a useful module, it registers a few oslo.config
options, which can possibly lead to unpleasant issues
(DuplicateOptError) when we split oslo.db from oslo-incubator into a
separate library and reuse both lockutils and oslo.db in target
projects. Unfortunately, we can't just remove usage of oslo.config
options from locktutils as it can break backward compatibility for
existing deployments.
The general approach of solving DuplicateOptError issues for oslo
libraries is not to depend on oslo.config as much as possible. So it's
actually worth to have a small code duplication here for the sake of
oslo.db as a standalone library in the future.

Change-Id: I7e3c5e1e9f7df0fec01e0d484e709cb2375025f1

commit_message:
Fix the grub2 config location for non Ubuntu/Debian systems

Fedora and openSUSE use /boot/grub2/grub.cfg for the grub2
configuration. The path that was used for Fedora before
(/boot/grub/grub.conf) is only valid for older grub releases.

Change-Id: I1e532c73a373a2c3f92211eff52719c2b635b7e3

Sylvain, I've thought about this patch set and I suppose we may do the following to make it look nicer. Here I have some thoughts:

1/ we agreed, we'll do hooks mechanism to use for additional methods later, thats why now you implement separated inherited from Lease Manager class
2/ now you have class choosing magic in cmd/manager.py That works ok, but the only reason for it is two classes. And one of them is just child and can do everything parent can.
3/ We may use always HostManager instead of Lease Manager, because it can do everything his parent can. But we'll remove this class after 1/ will be implemented.

That's why after some thinking I propose to move hosts related manager methods to the just Manager class. There are not so many of them, they won't do Manager code strange or something. Let's discuss it, but I believe that's the best way."}, {'account_id': 3012, 'date': '2013-11-27 10:31:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

As discussed in out IRC channel, change to the +1.
If there will be next patch set, we'll review it. If no, we'll land this commit as is to have working hosts reservation asap."}, {'account_id': 7535, 'date': '2013-11-27 11:45:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Monkey-patching is bad.

It is bad in many ways, I don't want to list them here.

We should have some dynamic dispatcher in place that would send calls to appropriate plugins' methods when they are called. There can be some code to do this in oslo. Maybe we should wait for oslo.messaging patch to land first.

Overall I would suggest to land the previous patchset to finally have the functionality in the code and work on the ways to do a clean plugin separation afterwards."}, {'account_id': 3012, 'date': '2013-11-29 06:39:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Add Host Reservation Admin Manager

API extensions are provided using a RPC dispatcher
We need to explicitly mention plugin:method when calling.
If not, it will stick to core methods for ManagerService.

Implements bp:host-provisioning-api

Change-Id: Ice5a07eef54664651c22b6b1185be38062c7296e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-19 08:07:05.000000000', 'message': 'Configure os-collect-config on seed properly

Without this the seed os-collect-config splats errors into its logs
every 30 seconds.

Change-Id: Ic3bda2aa9ecf7ce696a6c835eff4ce5ec98306d2
'}]
commit_message:
Configure os-collect-config on seed properly

Without this the seed os-collect-config splats errors into its logs
every 30 seconds.

Change-Id: Ic3bda2aa9ecf7ce696a6c835eff4ce5ec98306d2

commit_message:
Add element to modify /etc/apt/sources.list in dib

Add apt-sources element for Ubuntu OS to override the default
/etc/apt/sources.list in cloudimg.

Set DIB_APT_SOURCES with a proper sources.list file to replace
the default one.

If you want to use this element in tripleo project, set NODE_DIST or
EXTRA_ELEMENTS / UNDERCLOUD_DIB_EXTRA_ARGS / OVERCLOUD_DIB_EXTRA_ARGS
to make it take effect at build time and run time.

e.g. before running devtest.sh:
export DIB_APT_SOURCES=/etc/apt/sources.list
export NODE_DIST="ubuntu apt-sources"

Change-Id: I9ce0d03b506c2948b96382e4d6e85f0aff906450

commit_message:
add support for nova ssh user@host

the nova ssh command is convenient, but it is lacking some basic
niceties that everyone is used to with ssh, for instance actually
doing user@host to connect to an environment. This adds support
for "nova ssh user@host" to work as one would expect.

The functionality is added to both v1.1 and v3 clients. Tests for
this, and other ssh behavior are added to the v1.1 tree (the v3
test_shell.py has not synced over yet).

Change-Id: Ic4081f85c848507ebdc5e228ac345faf19127168

commit_message:
Extend vlan_splinters control behaviour

Change vlan_splinters control in openstack.json from checkbox to
radio group with 3 values: 'disabled', 'soft', and 'hard'.
'Soft' version always provides a 'trunk' field as a [0].
'Hard' version puts all vlan numbers from this interface to a 'trunk'
field.

bug 1257604

Change-Id: I9c1bbfc95eb777937bf0a9654d6f3cbc912055b9

eventlet doesn't support python 3, so until it does, I have no interest in python 3 compatibility changes for Swift.

I'll leave my review at -1 in case two other core reviewers want to override me, but I find it unlikely."}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2013-12-18 18:52:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm going to let it slide. Eventlet is a problem, but on the other hand Python 2 is a problem too. Pythonista are holding us by the balls by withholding all good fixes from Python 2. We ought to do something. Maybe not this, but something."}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2013-12-18 23:01:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Do not merge

It's not feasible to migrate to Py3 at this time. I do not want to add another dependency to support something that isn't realistic at this time."}, {'account_id': 6282, 'date': '2013-12-18 23:30:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 9107, 'date': '2013-12-19 10:47:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Pete: "I'm going to let it slide. Eventlet is a problem, but on the other hand Python 2 is a problem too. Pythonista are holding us by the balls by withholding all good fixes from Python 2. We ought to do something. Maybe not this, but something."

Hi,

You cannot reject such Swift changeset because eventlet blocks. Let me explain.

I'm working on a project to replace eventlet with asyncio/Tulip. I wrote an experimental backport of Tulip for Python 2.7. I will start to experiment asyncio/Tulip with Oslo Messaging, I'm porting this component on Python 3.

Eventlet cannot be replaced with a Python 3 module (asyncio) if the code is not already Python 3 compatible. A changeset porting Swift at once to Python 3 *and* replace eventlet with asyncio/Tulip would be really huge. It is not how OpenStack is developed, we work step by step with small patches addressing a single issue.

Adding parenthesis to print, replacing xrange with six.range, etc. are just a preparation work for the real job, replacing eventlet with something else.

I just wrote a first article explaining "Why should OpenStack move to Python 3 right now?":
http://techs.enovance.com/6521/openstack_python3

I'm writing a second article to explain the plan (decided with Chmouel Boudjnah, Doug Hellman and Julien Dangou) to replace eventlet with asyncio/Tulip.

John: "It's not feasible to migrate to Py3 at this time. I do not want to add another dependency to support something that isn't realistic at this time."

The six module is widely used. It's used in many OpenStack components. The module is written in pure Python and is mature.'}]

commit_message:
Replace xrange in for loop with six.moves.range

xrange is not supported in python 3, so replace it with six.moves.range

Change-Id: I5213d222ea417d249dbb7e952bb8a7a20096525c
Closes-Bug: #1262147

commit_message:
Fix building mysql element on non-upstart systems

Without this change we fail to build the element because /etc/init does
not exist.

commit_message:
Revert "Work around neutron floatingip race condition"

This reverts commit 38ac22ce7c4ea4ee9a86e1b6f2c3e5e31c8ba652.

Neutron claim the symptoms are fixed but there may be more issues
under the hood - we should see if thats the case.

Change-Id: I7e4c9448d9fc8ae10522d33495e9f6d2de64c129

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-21 09:13:52.000000000', 'message': 'Implement periodic execution of benchmark scenarios

Being able to run benchmark scenarios not continuously but periodically,
setting the interval between two consecutive benchmark scenario runs,
is a crucial part of making Rally closer to real-world cloud usage scenarios.

Here we add such a capability by adding a new execution type, namely
"periodic". We also add new scenario config parameter "interval" which
enables the user to set the interval between two consecutive scenario
runs in seconds.

A sample benchmark config for periodical booting/deleting 5 servers with
pauses lasting 2 minutes now would look like this:

"benchmark": {
    "NovaServers.boot_and_delete_server": [
        {"args": {"flavor_id": 1,
                  "image_id": "73257560-c59b-4275-a1ec-ab140e5b9979"},
         "execution": "periodic",
         "config": {"times": 5, "interval": 120,
                    "tenants": 3, "users_per_tenant": 2}}
    ]
}

Blueprint flexible-benchmark-config

Change-Id: I21a0a89f60bd5aaf9b3f419f72cdec7842bc7c38

commit_message:
Implement periodic execution of benchmark scenarios

Being able to run benchmark scenarios not continuously but periodically,
setting the interval between two consecutive benchmark scenario launches,
is a crucial part of making Rally closer to real-world cloud usage scenarios.

Here we add such a capability by adding a new execution type, namely
"periodic". We also add new scenario config parameter "interval" which
enables the user to set the interval between two consecutive scenario
launches in minutes.

A sample benchmark config for periodical booting/deleting 5 servers, one
server every 2 minutes, now would look like this:

"benchmark": {
    "NovaServers.boot_and_delete_server": [
        {"args": {"flavor_id": 1,
                  "image_id": "73257560-c59b-4275-a1ec-ab140e5b9979"},
         "execution": "periodic",
         "config": {"times": 5, "period": 2,
                    "tenants": 3, "users_per_tenant": 2}}
    ]
}

Blueprint flexible-benchmark-config

Change-Id: I21a0a89f60bd5aaf9b3f419f72cdec7842bc7c38

commit_message:
Separate negative tests for list_floating_ips

Add negative tests for test_list_floating_ips to a specific file.
Since no floating_ips are needed to setup for negative test,
generation of non existent id can be simplified.

bp negative-test-files

Change-Id: I1d3ac0956ea3f69bbd5bde897f0a18fc0e182930

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-18 02:31:36.000000000', 'message': "Addressed underlying issues associated with misplaced colon

Upon further investigation, the 'NOVA_DBPASS' reference in the
sentence including the misplaced colon should reside with the database
creation step now located further into this section.  The best
solution probably involves opening another bug to clarify this
section by reordering several steps.  For example, database creation
seems like a prerequisite for configuring the 'connection' key in
nova.conf.  Additionally, at least in the Ubuntu guide, configuring
the keys under [keystone_authtoken] in nova.conf should reside with
the step configuring Compute to use the Identity Service.

In the meantime, unless suggested otherwise, I changed the minimal
number of items to remove the misplaced colon and improve clarity
using the existing sequence of steps.

Change-Id: I5b24d55f236b6b4cf675707ebce34180187b788e
Closes-Bug: #1261607
"}, {'created': '2013-12-18 14:27:36.000000000', 'message': "Addressed underlying issues associated with misplaced colon

commit_message:
Addressed underlying issues associated with misplaced colon

Upon further investigation, the 'NOVA_DBPASS' reference in the
sentence including the misplaced colon should reside with the database
creation step now located further into this section.  The best
solution probably involves opening another bug to clarify this
section by reordering several steps.  For example, database creation
seems like a prerequisite for configuring the 'connection' key in
nova.conf.  Additionally, at least in the Ubuntu guide, configuring
the keys under [keystone_authtoken] in nova.conf should reside with
the step configuring Compute to use the Identity Service.

In the meantime, unless suggested otherwise, I changed the minimal
number of items to remove the misplaced colon and improve clarity
using the existing sequence of steps.

Change-Id: I5b24d55f236b6b4cf675707ebce34180187b788e
Closes-Bug: #1261607

commit_message:
Python 3: use six.moves.zip() rather than itertools.izip()

This ensures compatibility with both Python 2 and Python 3.

Change-Id: Id9838b7517f939e5ee3e3a8c37ae5ec2e9b1d18b

commit_message:
Remove premature restart of Keystone service during configuration

For simplification purposes, restarting the Keystone service
should wait until after configuring all relevant directives
in keystone.conf.

Change-Id: Id26edc20236953215dd18635fbe143f4bc1bc8da
Closes-Bug: #1258651

commit_message:
Strip '/' from api_url string for PXE driver

Because ironic_api_url PXE option used in hardcoded script for posting
callback data we should use only url string without '/' on the end.
It is necessary for case if Ironic API URL option set like
"http://127.0.0.1:6385/".

Change-Id: Iddd237e8aa90fd17f836cfd2060468f34e0de232

commit_message:
Fix XML to JSON parser

Some response bodies has got a lists as part of values for some
keys, but when XML is being parsed this is not considered.
Because of that tests that work correctly for JSON fail for XML.

Closes-bug: #1259870

Change-Id: Ib9b5c2d695258102bbc932f7babc614b0f847455

commit_message:
Add quotes around $DISTRO

The lsb_release -si output might contain spaces. E.g. on openSUSE it is
"openSUSE project".

Change-Id: I0e37bab54d0156f484433246bba7cdc686326c86

[{'created': '2013-12-18 14:07:35.000000000', 'message': "Set the correct path to os-collect-config

os-collect-config is installed in /usr/bin. This adjusts the systemd
service file accordingly to make it work for openSUSE. On Fedora the
wrong path didn't cause any problems because /bin is just a symlink to
/usr/bin there.

Change-Id: I2f02b12f9667920196084ee0abef1c9f676d413a
"}]
commit_message:
Set the correct path to os-collect-config

os-collect-config is installed in /usr/bin. This adjusts the systemd
service file accordingly to make it work for openSUSE. On Fedora the
wrong path didn't cause any problems because /bin is just a symlink to
/usr/bin there.

Change-Id: I2f02b12f9667920196084ee0abef1c9f676d413a

commit_message:
Switch to oslo-incubator mask_password

oslo-incubator has a mask_password now, so use that rather than
keystone's.

Change-Id: I3d89fb844086b85598ad3fd7ae0daa7599a26a30

commit_message:
Use Image IDs to make image based updates work

Currently Heat won't know that the Image ID of the names have changed,
so we have to pass in new image ids to make sure the updates actually
deploy the new image.

We change load-image to just output the Image ID to make this task
simpler.

Change-Id: I13031356c09cdeb3a606fd42da91cb8febc9849d

amotoki:
that patch just cures the problem, not the root cause.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-11-28 09:09:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The goal of my proposal was minimizing unnecessary chatter, and as you say it fixes the symptom but not the cause.  I would argue that this proposal similarly addresses the symptom, just at a different level.  I would rather see the agents updated to not send the unwanted fields, and I will update my patch to log all unexpected kwargs at debug so at least operators don't have to see it."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-11-28 12:29:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-12-03 06:42:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Maru Newby and amotoki,
things are complicated, the openstack common context is using tenant and user, but projects such as nova and neutron are using project_id, tenant_id and user_id.

nova has its own pop up at https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/context.py#L143

our codes are using tenant_id a lot, but the base context is using tenant, so I think we need a conversion somewhere anyway.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-12-11 06:03:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Use BaseTestCase from oslo Part 1

Replace base class for tests with BaseTestCase from
openstack/common/test.py

In this part only tests which inherit
from old base class directly are changed.

Oslo commit: 5d6d24c4e7d674b3f804e250983e835840b45039

Change-Id: Ia4bae39c00cde0a6accc2f6b4e55fc973d7d0ea1

After a quick glance this looks good. I would suggest that we run these tests optimistically under the py26 and py27 environments like the DB migration tests are run. This way the tests will just run under Jenkins.

To get MySQL to pass on Jenkins in this way we will need to relax the permissions of the openstack_citest user so that it can create new DB schemas on the slaves (to accommodate multiple test runners). This should work with PostgreSQL today so you can at least check that that works.'}, {'account_id': 5652, 'date': '2013-07-11 20:18:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

[{'created': '2013-06-17 09:57:57.000000000', 'message': "Run DB API tests on a given DB backend.

To proposed solution:
  - uses testrepository facilities to create a separate test
    environment for each process running a portion of test
    cases, i. e. a separate DB is created for each of test processes,
    so that they can safely be run concurrently without any data races
  - DB transactions are used to ensure that DB remains in a clean state
    after running of a test case: each test case is executed within a
    transaction which is rolled back after the test has ended.
    The 'create DB/apply migrations/run a test case/drop DB' pattern
    we currently use for running tests on SQLite in-memory DB is not an
    option, because it would take enormous amount of time to do this
    for MySQL or PostgreSQL
  - a new tox environment is added for running of DB API tests
    (as these are the only tests we want to run on DB backends other
    than SQLite in-memory DB)

To run DB API tests on a specific DB backend do:
  OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION=mysql://test:test@localhost/test tox -e dbapi

Note: this connection is used to create/drop test databases/users, ensure that
the specified users has appropriate rights. If OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION
env variable is not specified, DB API tests are run on SQLite in-memory DB.

Blueprint: db-api-tests-on-all-backends

Change-Id: Ia1128c4f9d1230935a78a2c2363daacafef0f4db

commit_message:
Run DB API tests on a given DB backend

To proposed solution:
  - uses testrepository facilities to create a separate test
    environment for each process running a portion of test
    cases, i. e. a separate DB is created for each of test processes,
    so that they can safely be run concurrently without any data races
  - DB transactions are used to ensure that DB remains in a clean state
    after running of a test case: each test case is executed within a
    transaction which is rolled back after the test has ended.
    The 'create DB/apply migrations/run a test case/drop DB' pattern
    we currently use for running tests on SQLite in-memory DB is not an
    option, because it would take enormous amount of time to do this
    for MySQL or PostgreSQL
  - a new tox environment is added for running of DB API tests
    (as these are the only tests we want to run on DB backends other
    than SQLite in-memory DB)

To run DB API tests on a specific DB backend do:
  OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION=mysql://test:test@localhost/test tox -e dbapi

Note: this connection is used to create/drop test databases/users, ensure that
the specified users has appropriate rights. If OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION
env variable is not specified, DB API tests are run on SQLite in-memory DB.

Uses code from oslo-incubator, that hasn't been merged yet:
Ic5d3cfe8764b3c04affe79088473255c17535e54

Blueprint: db-api-tests-on-all-backends

Co-authored-By: Ilya Pekelny <ipekelny@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: Ia1128c4f9d1230935a78a2c2363daacafef0f4db

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-01 14:44:16.000000000', 'message': 'Scripts for running WSGI application.

Scripts definition:

  nailgun_rcp - run RPC cunsomer in separate process;
  nailgun_keepalive - run KeepAlive checker in separate process;
  share/nailgun_wsgi - WSGI application.

Notes:
  if uses python 2.7 then shared files is installed inside package.
  nailgun_wsgi_path console script returns path to nailgun_wsgi file

  How to use nailgun_wsgi_path:
    uwsgi -s 127.0.0.1:8001 -wsgi-file $(/opt/nailgun/bin/nailgun_wsgi_path)

  if uses python 2.5 then nailgun_wsgi is installed to
  /opt/nailgun/share/nailgun_wsgi

For run nailgun using uwsgi need change supervisord.conf.

Change-Id: I1f5fe75e49feefedee015f4e750d4ae3e2951f33
'}, {'created': '2013-11-05 10:55:33.000000000', 'message': 'Scripts to run nailgun using external app server.

Scripts description:

  nailgun/bin/nailgun_keepalive
     Run KeepAlive checker in separate process;
     Will be installed to <venv>/bin.

  nailgun/bin/nailgun_rcp
     Run RPC consumer in separate process.
     Will be installed to <venv>/bin.

  nailgun/bin/nailgun_wsgi_path
     Return path for nailgun_wsgi;
     Will be installed to <venv>/bin.

  nailgun/wsgi/nailgun_wsgi
     WSGI application.
     Will be installed to share directory (see notes below).

Notes:

  If you are using Python 2.7 then share files is installed inside package.

  If you are using Python 2.6 then nailgun_wsgi is installed to
  <sys.prefix>/share/nailgun_wsgi.

  nailgun_wsgi_path console script returns path to nailgun_wsgi file.
  For example:
    uwsgi -s 127.0.0.1:8001 -wsgi-file $(/opt/nailgun/bin/nailgun_wsgi_path)

Change-Id: I1f5fe75e49feefedee015f4e750d4ae3e2951f33

commit_message:
Scripts to run nailgun using external app server.

Scripts description:

  nailgun/bin/nailgun_keepalive
     Run KeepAlive checker in separate process;
     Will be installed to <venv>/bin.

  nailgun/bin/nailgun_rcp
     Run RPC consumer in separate process.
     Will be installed to <venv>/bin.

  nailgun/bin/nailgun_wsgi_path
     Return path for nailgun_wsgi;
     Will be installed to <venv>/bin.

  nailgun/wsgi/nailgun_wsgi
     WSGI application.
     Will be installed to share directory (see notes below).

Notes:

  If you are using Python 2.7 then shared files are installed inside package.

  If you are using Python 2.6 then nailgun_wsgi is installed to
  <sys.prefix>/share/nailgun_wsgi.

  nailgun_wsgi_path console script returns path to nailgun_wsgi file.
  For example:
    uwsgi -s 127.0.0.1:8001 --wsgi-file $(/opt/nailgun/bin/nailgun_wsgi_path)

Change-Id: I1f5fe75e49feefedee015f4e750d4ae3e2951f33

commit_message:
Use BaseTestCase from oslo Part 2

Replace base class for tests with BaseTestCase from
openstack/common/test.py

Add new base class for tests which need to set
property protections. Inherit StoreClearingUnitTest,
IsolatedUnitTest and UsingPolicyFileMixinTest
from it.

Oslo commit: 5d6d24c4e7d674b3f804e250983e835840b45039

Change-Id: Ifb463ecffc2d7ead9af7fc390353e5d40967bd44

Change-Id: I862d004bc4b06adc8e7cc86371a6b9fe6179b562

commit_message:
Use /etc/tempest for Tempest conf file

Other projects use /etc to store conf file. According to
lib/template, /etc should be used to store conf file. This
patch makes Tempest compliant.

Change-Id: I862d004bc4b06adc8e7cc86371a6b9fe6179b562

I noticed tempest failed, I think you hit bug(s):

- https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1253896

We don't automatically recheck or reverify, so please consider
doing that manually if someone hasn't already. For a code review
which is not yet approved, you can recheck by leaving a code
review comment with just the text:

    recheck bug 1253896

For a code review which has been approved but failed to merge,
you can reverify by leaving a comment like this:

"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-12-11 15:17:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(8 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 9638, 'date': '2013-12-11 17:05:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

add Vish Ishaya who added the 'disabled' flag to flavor one year ago.

The use case with 'disabled' for us is that:
1. when a flavor is disabled, it will be invisible to a tenant while calling 'nova flavor-list'. Which means a tenant can not use the disabled flavor to create new instance.

Admin will use this flag to temporarily disable a flavor in case of resource limitation or upgrading process, etc.

2. however if a flavor is already used by instances, 'disabled' flag does not prevent accessing it through flavor_id. This makes sure that when a flavor is disabled, all exiting functions using the flavor will not break.


I would like to know what is the original use case for the 'disabled' flag ?"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-12-19 06:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-12-19 06:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Add a CLI to disable/enable a flavor

If a flavor is disabled, it is invisible to tenants while show a list of flavors.
But if a flavor is already associated with instances, a tenants can still access it by the flavor_id.

usage: nova flavor-disabled <flavor> <disabled>

Sample request:
REQ: curl -i 770bbdfdd5c2472383641bb33b77725a/flavors/12">http://127.0.0.1:8774/v2/770bbdfdd5c2472383641bb33b77725a/flavors/12
                 -d '{"flavor": {"OS-FLV-DISABLED:disabled": true}}

Sample output from CLI:

cloud@devstack:~$ nova help flavor-disabled
usage: nova flavor-disabled <flavor_id> <disabled>

Change the visibility of a flavor between Enabled and Disabled.

Positional arguments:
  <flavor_id>  flavor id.
  <disabled>   value of disabled (true or false).

cloud@devstack:~$ nova flavor-disabled 12 true
+--------------------------+-------+
| Property                 | Value |
+--------------------------+-------+
| OS-FLV-DISABLED:disabled | True  |
| disk                     | 0     |
| extra_specs              | {}    |
| id                       | 12    |
| name                     | test  |
| ram                      | 1024  |
| vcpus                    | 1     |
+--------------------------+-------+

cloud@devstack:~$ nova flavor-list
+----+-----------+-----------+------+-----------+------+-------+-------------+-----------+----------+
| ID | Name      | Memory_MB | Disk | Ephemeral | Swap | VCPUs | RXTX_Factor | Is_Public | Disabled |
+----+-----------+-----------+------+-----------+------+-------+-------------+-----------+----------+
| 1  | m1.tiny   | 512       | 1    | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 12 | test      | 1024      | 0    | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | True     |
| 13 | test1     | 1024      | 0    | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 2  | m1.small  | 2048      | 20   | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 3  | m1.medium | 4096      | 40   | 0         |      | 2     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 4  | m1.large  | 8192      | 80   | 0         |      | 4     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 42 | m1.nano   | 64        | 0    | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 5  | m1.xlarge | 16384     | 160  | 0         |      | 8     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 84 | m1.micro  | 128       | 0    | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
+----+-----------+-----------+------+-----------+------+-------+-------------+-----------+----------+

Change-Id: I0f244c4bcc7e56d6181445b5d58785607a8dac03
Closes-Bug: #1259262

commit_message:
Port policy from oslo

Port policy from oslo and update glance/api/policy
Update tests.

Add new base class UsingPolicyFileMixinTest for tests which use
policy file. It helps to add the path to tests/etc/policy.json
as policy_file to CONF.

Add unit tests for Enforcer's methods:
- clear
- set_rules
- load_rules

Oslo commit: 76972e2949634abe9fcc9ad36c103cca94300237

Change-Id: I1132b209dfe09d95ba31a741fbacb3fc499ec2cb

"}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-12-11 17:57:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

+1 for SHA256

-1 for breaking backward compatibility

There are a couple of options I can think of.

1. migrate the existing token
2. do the fetch twice, first with the MD5 hash token ID, then the SHA256"}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2013-12-11 18:45:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I have a secondary concern.  In high-token churn environments we have hit the limits of some token backends (memcache) being able to support the entire token-list for users/revocations.  At least for ICEHOUSE we need to be aware of that limitation.  This change would effectively halve the number of tokens in either list (memcache has fixed page sizes).  

I am working on fixes that will help to address that by using over-flow pages and the like, but there is overhead and a lot of other issues associated with it.

Suggestion: Make this configurable.  Default is MD5, if you specify SHA256, it only uses sha256, if you enable "compat mode" or something like that it'll check the options in order. (SHA256 then MD5?).  At the very least for compatibility sake, it should be made configurable so that the deployer can decide when/if they want to convert over.'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2013-12-11 18:45:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-12-11 21:39:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

Thanks for the feedback. Let me address it.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-12-19 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-12-19 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

By coincidence, the table column sizes are big enough for handling
SHA256 hashes, so the only thing needed seems to be to change
the actual hashing algorithm.

Change-Id: I6949ea0bdcfb9c37a83ec968eff9f21cbb974832
Closes-Bug: #1174499

commit_message:
Use SHA256 for hashing tokens

By coincidence, the table column sizes are big enough for handling
SHA256 hashes, so the only thing needed seems to be to change
the actual hashing algorithm.

Change-Id: I6949ea0bdcfb9c37a83ec968eff9f21cbb974832
Closes-Bug: #1174499

commit_message:
Fix simple db's treatment of image tags

Simple db allows setting image tags when calling image_create and returns image
tags as part of the image entity when calling image_get. This is unlike
sqlalchemy driver and is not the correct behavior. Image tags are not part of
the core image entity because v1 of the api should not return them.

This patch also fixes tests that incorrectly expect this behavior.

prerequisite to blueprint remove-simple-driver

Fixes bug 1247655

Change-Id: Iad06279cf59acc542e3b3fc3b72a6050f5c90bc5

commit_message:
Provide a deprecated function

This is starting to be needed in a number of places, provide a decorator
and a print method to notify of deprecated functions attributes or
parameters.

Change-Id: Idaee4ab3b5efe6fbee414a8d6274e60ff584dc74

commit_message:
Ignore nbactions.xml

This file is a per-user build customization file created by NetBeans,
which is often created for documentation projects to define the
"clean generate-sources" action for easy access in the UI.

Change-Id: I63b8302f41f00858c400f028f1ffec6566fd288d

It doesn't seem to hurt IPv4, but I couldn't get an IPv6 address to work.  The call worked in the python REPL, but the monkeypatched eventlet version of socket.getaddrinfo() tried to resolve the IPv6 address as if it were a hostname, which didn't work.

Did you test this and successfully send StatsD UDP packets to an IPv6 host?  Did you have to use a hostname which resolved to a IPv6 address or something?"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-10-23 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

I don't think we can unilaterally deprecate  the SQL connection, as it is going to break on all upgrades we either need to automatically migrate, or use the old value until people have a chance to migrate themselves.

Is it possible to activate the [sql] config options the same way as the [database] ones are, and to fill in the [database] connection with the [sql] one if the [sql] is present and the [database] one is missing?"}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-12-12 05:46:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 23: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

@ayoung, I think we are good. This change should be backward compatible. See

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/61609/1/keystone/openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/session.py

line 281 and 282. Seem like its already accounted for the deprecated options in the [sql] section if present and the [database] section is absent."}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-12-12 13:58:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Use oslo.db sessions

Keystone was using its own keystone.common.sql module for
database access. oslo-incubator's db.sqlalchemy module provides
the same or better functionality, so use that instead.

DocImpact
- The options that were in the [sql] section are deprecated and
  replaced by options in the [database] section. There are
  also several new options in this section. If database
  configuration is described for another project that uses
  oslo-incubator's db.sqlalchemy module the docs can be shared.

Part of bp use-common-oslo-db-code

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-16 14:17:15.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid meaningless comparison that leads to a TypeError

The "requests" module tries to do this comparison in raise_for_status():

    400 <= self.status_code < 500

with "self.status_code" being "None". In Python2, it's a valid comparison, but
in Python3, it triggers a TypeError. We fix it by giving a value to
"self.status_code".

Change-Id: I9ea9ecfb698546a7f6526464aa528441bb7c1ccd
'}, {'created': '2013-12-16 14:25:25.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid meaningless comparison that leads to a TypeError

The "requests" module tries to do this comparison in raise_for_status():

    400 <= self.status_code < 500

with "self.status_code" being "None". In Python2, it's a valid comparison, but
in Python3, it triggers a TypeError. We fix it by giving a valid default value
to "self.status_code".

Change-Id: I9ea9ecfb698546a7f6526464aa528441bb7c1ccd
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid meaningless comparison that leads to a TypeError

The "requests" module tries to do this comparison in raise_for_status():

    400 <= self.status_code < 500

with "self.status_code" being "None". In Python2, it's a valid comparison, but
in Python3, it triggers a TypeError. We fix it by giving a valid default value
to "self.status_code".

Change-Id: I9ea9ecfb698546a7f6526464aa528441bb7c1ccd

commit_message:
Add another clarifying note on nova-net install

We had another bug report about the nova-network install section.

This patch adds another very explicit,
clarifying note to ensure people are installing
packages in the right place.

Change-Id: Ifc48813af9ec1cf8a87aab96c3f95c8d474595c9
Closes-bug: 1261620
(cherry picked from commit ffa01a2c2314f16f25c7f0179c498297d2f0f9cc)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-18 18:48:32.000000000', 'message': "Fix obj versioning w/non-ASCII container name

If you create a container with a non-ASCII name, and then make another
container with X-Versions-Location: first-cÃ¸ntÃ¥Ã®ner, *and* you're
serializing stuff in memcache as json (the default), when the proxy
tries to make a versioned object, it will crash.

The fix is to make sure that get_container_info() always returns strs,
not unicodes.

The long-term fix would be to get rid of simplejson entirely, as its
decoder can't make up its mind whether JSON strings should be Python
strs or unicodes, and that makes it really really easy to write bugs
like this.

Change-Id: Ib20ea5fb884484a4246d7a21a9f1e2ffd82eb04f
"}]
commit_message:
Fix obj versioning w/non-ASCII container name

If you create a container with a non-ASCII name, and then make another
container with X-Versions-Location: first-cÃ¸ntÃ¥Ã®ner, *and* you're
serializing stuff in memcache as json (the default), when the proxy
tries to make a versioned object, it will crash.

The fix is to make sure that get_container_info() always returns strs,
not unicodes.

The long-term fix would be to get rid of simplejson entirely, as its
decoder can't make up its mind whether JSON strings should be Python
strs or unicodes, and that makes it really really easy to write bugs
like this.

Change-Id: Ib20ea5fb884484a4246d7a21a9f1e2ffd82eb04f

setup_container. But it's missed to reset in function mount() and
teardown().
This patch is to fix it.

"}, {'created': '2013-12-05 02:35:39.000000000', 'message': "LXC: Image device should be reset in mount() and teardown()

When fixing bug#1208387, image device name is returned in function
setup_container. But it's missed to reset in function mount() and
teardown().

This patch is to fix it. We now just return the device name when
mounting disk image during setting up container and remove the
member variable 'device' from Class _DiskImage added in last patch.

Closes-bug: #1243108
Related-bug: #1208387

commit_message:
LXC: Image device should be reset in mount() and teardown()

When fixing bug#1208387, image device name is returned in function
setup_container. But it's missed to reset in function mount() and
teardown().

This patch is to fix it. We now just return the device name when
mounting disk image during setting up container and remove the
member variable 'device' from Class _DiskImage added in last patch.

Closes-bug: #1243108
Related-bug: #1208387

Change-Id: I2aaed6f3367edce4fb23b78f0e979440954609a8

commit_message:
Rename instance_type to flavor in nova.utils and nova.compute.utils

Renames 'instance_type' to 'flavor' in nova.utils and nova.compute.utils
and related tests. Removes the unused fake_get method in
test_compute_utils.

Note that the nova.notifications payload isn't updated yet to store
flavor instead of instance_type so this patch still uses
payload['instance_type'] when processing the notification in
test_compute_utils.

Note that instance_type_id and the instance_type_* keys in
system_metadata are part of the data model and would require a database
migration to change, so those are not part of this patch.

Part of blueprint flavor-instance-type-dedup

Change-Id: I56815e5c8238f8e4ad4e3a2a599310da2b7f4568

commit_message:
Rename instance_type to flavor in nova.cloudpipe

Renames 'instance_type' to 'flavor' in the nova.cloudpipe module.

The deprecated vpn_instance_type option is removed as part of
change I64548e40f so I leave it untouched here.

Part of blueprint flavor-instance-type-dedup

Change-Id: Id4fd757fabfb81ee81999e7978c924aabd0a712b

commit_message:
Use the ephemeral disk on rackspace performance nodes

They don't come with swap, so match what we do for HP.

Change-Id: I4f81608c962bb7c1a03e7b5597759c1f40c0971c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-13 09:49:54.000000000', 'message': 'Removes log generation parameters from EXTRA_OPTS

Reasons:
- No need of using these parameters.
- Logging could be managed on its own by nova.
- Would help to reduce logfiles generation,
  hence making the maintenance easier.
- All other components are already doing this way.

Changes:
- Removed logdir from EXTRA_OPTS.
- Removed logfile_mode from EXTRA_OPTS.

If needed by user, one can modify the nova.conf to
generate logfiles at their desired location.

Change-Id: I301b8a2fa1522965442efa72e21085389ee662f8
Closes-Bug: #1260648
'}]
commit_message:
Removes log generation parameters from EXTRA_OPTS

Reasons:
- No need of using these parameters.
- Logging could be managed on its own by nova.
- Would help to reduce logfiles generation,
  hence making the maintenance easier.
- All other components are already doing this way.

Changes:
- Removed logdir from EXTRA_OPTS.
- Removed logfile_mode from EXTRA_OPTS.

If needed by user, one can modify the nova.conf to
generate logfiles at their desired location.

Change-Id: I301b8a2fa1522965442efa72e21085389ee662f8
Closes-Bug: #1260648

I thought about that, but I do not think it is the role of django to log this kind of thing. I mean, if something gone wrong on nova it is not to horizon to log the error. The role of a front end is to display the information and be enough fault tolerant to display datas. If we log every faulting data we will encounter logging issues.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-11-24 22:46:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Fix parse_isotime filter into horizon

    parse_isotime was imported from oslo to horizon and became a filter,
    but it can raise an exception. If it occurs the template in which
    we use the filter will be broken. A fix has been made that allows the
    filter to fail silently and display a configurable default value.
    Some tests are now performed on this filter. According to Django
    defaultfilters nothing is logged when the evaluation fails.

Fixes bug #1253161

Change-Id: If44cde62c37371c5de7b7f81860f368f61b066bc

Fix tenant of admin can't delete vm

when tenant of admin create vm in another tenant's network,it allow to
delete that vm.

[{'created': '2013-12-18 18:41:39.000000000', 'message': 'Retry on deadlock in instance_metadata_update

THe instance_metadata_update() method in the sqlalchemy db API may hit a
DBDeadlock, as shown in the bug report.  Apply the necessary decorator
that will have the method retry in that case.

Change-Id: Ice3f13857ba8f4ee1d1d2dc06cef293e6d17daca
Closes-bug: #1262154
'}]
commit_message:
Retry on deadlock in instance_metadata_update

THe instance_metadata_update() method in the sqlalchemy db API may hit a
DBDeadlock, as shown in the bug report.  Apply the necessary decorator
that will have the method retry in that case.

Change-Id: Ice3f13857ba8f4ee1d1d2dc06cef293e6d17daca
Closes-bug: #1262154

Using contain_class instead of include_class

Per rspec-puppet-1.0.1 warning:

matchers/include_class.rb:7

commit_message:
Use Fedora 20 for DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_HEAT_SLOW

This adds a Fedora 20 image name to
$HEAT_FETCHED_TEST_IMAGE so that tempest is configured to
use it for orchestration tests requiring an image.

Fedora 20 has heat-cfntools pre-installed, so there is no
current need to run diskimage-builder during the gate run.

A separate change to devstack/stackrc will add the actual
URL to IMAGE_URLS which corresponds to this image name.

Change-Id: Iddfc6629f7c0108cb2a19c09e719ed839989bdb5

commit_message:
Adds method for misc options

This change adds support for miscellaneous options to be set.
Things that haven't been added as attributes, or specifically,
third party additions that don't belong in stackforge (e.g. cobalt)

Change-Id: Ib312333283275fa3581c912f8c55c8f2c6191705

commit_message:
Adds method for misc options

This change adds support for miscellaneous options to be set.
Things that haven't been added as attributes, or specifically,
third party additions that don't belong in stackforge (e.g. cobalt)

Change-Id: Ib312333283275fa3581c912f8c55c8f2c6191705

[{'created': '2013-12-13 21:49:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix failures when l3_agent_scheduler ext is not available

Some plugins do not support the L3 agent scheduler extension.
Therefore, make the tests that rely on it dependent on whether
this is actually available in the plugin under test.

Change-Id: I3154b646677379a34465c6826b71d4ad72c471a2
Closes-bug: #1231152
'}]
commit_message:
Fix failures when l3_agent_scheduler ext is not available

Some plugins do not support the L3 agent scheduler extension.
Therefore, make the tests that rely on it dependent on whether
this is actually available in the plugin under test.

Change-Id: I3154b646677379a34465c6826b71d4ad72c471a2
Closes-bug: #1231152

[{'created': '2013-12-18 23:21:24.000000000', 'message': 'Bug #1261894: Deleting Record With BIND 9 Driver Fails
Fix the delete_record() method so it deletes the record in the central storage before the BIND 9 backend gets the request to delete the record.

Change-Id: I0d1e00f441d2f2026734d90e7f015fdd40c7e137
Closes-bug: #1261894
'}, {'created': '2013-12-18 23:25:45.000000000', 'message': 'Bug #1261894: Deleting Record With BIND 9 Driver Fails

Fix the delete_record() method so it deletes the record in the central storage before the BIND 9 backend gets the request to delete the record.

commit_message:
Bug #1261894: Deleting Record With BIND 9 Driver Fails

Fix the delete_record() method so it deletes the record in the central storage before the BIND 9 backend gets the request to delete the record.

Change-Id: I0d1e00f441d2f2026734d90e7f015fdd40c7e137
Closes-bug: #1261894

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-03 21:00:55.000000000', 'message': 'scenario cross_tenant_connectivity

This test suite assumes that Nova has been configured to boot VM's with
Neutron-managed networking, and attempts to verify cross tenant connectivity
as follows

ssh:
    in order to overcome "ip namespace", each tenant has an "access point"  VM
    with floating-ip open to incoming ssh connection allowing network commands
    (ping/ssh) to be executed from within the tenant-network-namespace
    Tempest host performs key-based authentication to the ssh server via
    floating IP address

setup:
    for each tenant (demo and alt):
        1. create a network&subnet
        2. create a router (if public router isn't configured)
        3. connect tenant network to public network via router
        4. create an access point:
            a. a security group open to incoming ssh connection
            b. a VM with a floating ip
        5. for demo tenant - create another server to test in-tenant connections

connectivity test is done by pinging destination server via source server ssh
connection.
success - ping returns
failure - ping_timeout reached

tests:
        1. _verify_network_details
        2. _verify_mac_addr: for each access point verify that
        (subnet, fix_ip, mac address) are as defined in the port list
        3. _test_in_tenant_block: test that in-tenant traffic is disabled
        without rules allowing it
        4. _test_in_tenant_allow: test that in-tenant traffic is enabled once an
        appropriate rule has been created
        5. _test_cross_tenant_block: test that cross-tenant traffic is disabled
        without a rule allowing it on destination tenant
        6. _test_cross_tenant_allow:
            * test that cross-tenant traffic is enabled once an
            * appropriate rule
            has been created on destination tenant.
            * test that reverse traffic is still blocked
            * test than revesre traffic is enabled once an
            * appropriate
            * rule has been created on source tenant

assumptions:
        1. alt_tenant/user existed and is different from demo_tenant/user
        2. Public network is defined and reachable from the Tempest host
        3. Public router can either be:
            * defined, in which case all tenants networks can
            * connect directly
            to it, and cross tenant check will be done on the private IP of the
            destination tenant
            or
            * not defined (empty string), in which case each tanant
            * will have
            its own router connected to the public network

helper changes:

manager:
    1. move network and router creation to mananger
    (from scenario/test_network_basic_ops)
    2. add set_resource=True to _create_secgroup_rule() so you can create a rule
    not deleted by tearDown this is workaround for bug 1247568 in
    python-neutronclient (preventing tearDownClass from ignoring deleted neutron
    resources

Change-Id: I212873d46e20ff3161e376105af18020b1cf1c9d

commit_message:
scenario cross_tenant_connectivity

test conectivity between VMs in the same tenant and on different
tenants.
for each case, test that default state blocks traffic(*), that security
rules allow only specified traffic

(*)negative connectivity check is skipped until bug 1252620 is fixed
   TODO(yfried): enable them once bug is fixed

Also adds workaround for bug 1247568 in python-neutronclient (preventing
tearDownClass from ignoring deleted neutron resources

Change-Id: I212873d46e20ff3161e376105af18020b1cf1c9d

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-15 13:58:10.000000000', 'message': "Refactor network client

This patch implements the following steps in network client refactoring
1) Automatically 'generated' list_, show_, delete_ methods for most of
the resources
2) XML and JSon client implementations inherit common base
3) Every list method now supports filters

This change allow to remove existing list_, show_ and delete_ methods for
simple resources from both clients.

Some tests were fixed to simplify mapping between client method name and
resulting URI (example: list_floatingips instead of list_floating_ips)

Change-Id: I0eb46f8e3d90809dbfc54d4a250cd6aecfdc2c3b

3) Every list method now supports filters

This change allow to remove existing list_, show_ and delete_ methods for
simple resources from both clients.

Some tests were fixed to simplify mapping between client method name and
resulting URI (example: list_floatingips instead of list_floating_ips)

Change-Id: I0eb46f8e3d90809dbfc54d4a250cd6aecfdc2c3b
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor network client

This patch implements the following steps in network client refactoring
1) Automatically 'generated' list_, show_, delete_ methods for most of
the resources
2) XML and JSon client implementations inherit common base
3) Every list method now supports filters

This change allow to remove existing list_, show_ and delete_ methods for
simple resources from both clients.

Some tests were fixed to simplify mapping between client method name and
resulting URI (example: list_floatingips instead of list_floating_ips)

Change-Id: I0eb46f8e3d90809dbfc54d4a250cd6aecfdc2c3b

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-27 16:48:55.000000000', 'message': 'This patch adds a user authentication of incoming request.
 Currently two authentication strategies are supported:
 noauth (no authentication) and keystone.

This patch also includes unit test for authentication control via
configuration parameter auth_strategy. It adds
solum.openstack.common.fixtures component in order to use
openstack.config fixture in unit tests.

This patch adds python_keystoneclient into requirements.txt

Change-Id: I16aa0ba66eb8f5bf74e955245baba43118c89057
Implements: blueprint user-authentication
'}, {'created': '2013-11-28 18:22:29.000000000', 'message': 'This patch adds a user authentication of incoming request.

A new option enable_authentication is introduced in solum.conf
to control incoming request authentication via keystone. By default this
option has value False.
If this option is enabled (has value True) a keystoneclient.auth_token
middleware will be installed.

This patch adds python_keystoneclient into requirements.txt

Change-Id: I16aa0ba66eb8f5bf74e955245baba43118c89057
Implements: blueprint user-authentication
'}, {'created': '2013-12-10 00:49:09.000000000', 'message': 'This patch adds a user authentication of incoming request.

commit_message:
This patch adds a user authentication of incoming request.

A new option enable_authentication is introduced in solum.conf
to control incoming request authentication via keystone. By default this
option has value True.
If this option is enabled (has value True) a keystoneclient.auth_token
middleware will be installed.

test_functional.py file has beed removed as it is not
compatible with authentication changes. Tests from test_functional file
will be added to functionaltest folder by a separate commit.

This patch adds python_keystoneclient into requirements.txt
Change-Id: I16aa0ba66eb8f5bf74e955245baba43118c89057
Implements: blueprint user-authentication

commit_message:
Adds non-volume-support to create server with heat

Reasons:
- There is no supporting code for CONF.trove_volume_support = False.

Changes:
- Added code for CONF.trove_volume_support = False.

Change-Id: I048169e20c3ac713f44e7df85e6b691b707fa88c
Closes-Bug: #1262357

commit_message:
Parameterize the dhcp_lease_time

This change allows the site operator to override the
default dhcp_lease_time provided to DHCP clients in the
event they want a different value from the 120s default.

Change-Id: I7020120ef3ffcf5d9e73f48f3ebdaff853298842

'}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2013-12-09 10:34:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I don't really like making the cookbooks depend on patches and I don't know what is the use of having comments about Havana on the Grizzly branch.

But at least the URL of that patch should be mentioned in the comments or in the README. We shouldn't require users to look at the git history to find patch URLs."}, {'account_id': 7769, 'date': '2013-12-10 20:54:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7769, 'date': '2013-12-10 20:58:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Patch URL added to attributes file.

While in general I agree, however the attribute is innocuous without the patch, so there is no hard dependency.  

I have avoided the introduction of patches and kept those local but honestly anyone trying to use grizzly in a production environment will find the situation untenable without multiple quantum api workers given every nova call results in dozens of quantum api calls.

On top of that, the patch configuration parameter is forward compatible with the behavior in havana further reducing my skepticism about introducing it.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-10 21:02:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 6526, 'date': '2013-12-13 14:54:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Alan, could you please to commit your patch on api_workers in Grizzly neutron component first?

If you still want this change in cookbook grizzly branch I think you need do the cherry pick first in the Grizzly neutron component.'}, {'account_id': 26, 'date': '2013-12-17 15:47:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This needs to be rebased to the Grizzly branch and if it's still needed on the Havana branch it's probably worth a separate patch."}, {'account_id': 7769, 'date': '2013-12-18 22:57:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

commit_message:
Make wsgi attributes overridable

Allow the site operator to override wsgi attributes
and allows access to an api_workers attribute present
in Havana but also in Grizzly sites that are patched with
the following patch:

https://gist.github.com/alanmeadows/7770570

commit_message:
Make Heat's non_empty_stack usable without a server

We don't really need to test with a server to check Heat's
API responses. So just use a trivial resource type (a LaunchConfig)
to create some objects that we can query against. Now we can use
this test to gate.

Change-Id: I71bc065d8a1d2064ca90406543a376ce4d477275

commit_message:
Add Orchestration attributes to attribute file

Add Orchestration endpoint and database attribute to default attribute file,
which will be used by orchestration cookbook

Implements: blueprint heat-support

Change-Id: Ib6aa3f4e9346992308676e041ab2f0a0397abeac

"}, {'account_id': 9064, 'date': '2013-11-17 22:32:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I don't know or understand why you tried this complicated facter approach to deploy a monitor. Especially the need to two runs for such simple task as deploying a mon. We shouldn't go this way. Simply take a look at: https://github.com/TelekomCloud/puppet-ceph/blob/rc/eisbrecher/manifests/mon.pp 

This is a clean, simple and working implementation to deploy as many ceph mons as you need in one run and in parallel. 

From my point the key handling should be done via ceph::key.

I may missed something, but I would vote against this implementation (I would even tend to -2, but set -1 for now)"}, {'account_id': 2064, 'date': '2013-11-17 22:36:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-11-17 22:37:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGit#Test_Failures

- gate-puppet-ceph-puppet-lint http://logs.openstack.org/41/56841/3/check/gate-puppet-ceph-puppet-lint/176e4c2 : FAILURE in 2s
- gate-puppet-ceph-puppet-syntax http://logs.openstack.org/41/56841/3/check/gate-puppet-ceph-puppet-syntax/4b77959 : SUCCESS in 3s
