'}, {'created': '2013-12-10 09:44:30.000000000', 'message': "Replace TaskAction with TaskExecutor

This change introduces new entity in the ActionEngine internals,
TaskExecutor. It's responsibilities are simple: take task and it's
arguments and execute it or revert it when engine says so.

All the other responsibilites of TaskAction, like state changes,
fetching arguments and saving results, are moved to engine itself, where
they belong.

Implements blueprint task-executor
Change-Id: Ie52eba3bba5c730cee091ee24e995e0ba21f9486
"}, {'created': '2013-12-11 09:21:50.000000000', 'message': "Replace TaskAction with TaskExecutor

TaskExecutor. It's responsibilities are simple: take task and it's
arguments and execute it or revert it when engine says so.

All the other responsibilites of TaskAction, like state changes,
fetching arguments and saving results, are moved to engine itself, where
they belong.

Implements blueprint task-executor
Change-Id: Ie52eba3bba5c730cee091ee24e995e0ba21f9486
"}, {'created': '2013-12-11 10:17:39.000000000', 'message': "Introduce TaskExecutor

This change introduces new entity in the ActionEngine internals,
TaskExecutor. It's responsibilities are simple: take task and it's
arguments and execute it or revert it when engine says so.

engine itself.

commit_message:
Do not create TaskAction for each task

Instead of creating TaskAction for each task we create single TaskAction
in engine, that knows how to run tasks for it. We also got rid of engine
dependency of TaskAction, passing storage and notifier to it instead.

References blueprint task-executor
Co-authored-by: Ivan A. Melnikov <imelnikov@griddynamics.com>
Change-Id: Ie52eba3bba5c730cee091ee24e995e0ba21f9486

commit_message:
Storage: use names instead of uuids in interface

Instead of exposing and requiring engines and users to use uuids,
storage now provides more convenient interface that allows to do
anything with task by its name.

Storage is now the entity that maintains name-to-uuid mapping. To
emphasize that, find_by_name method (now unused) was removed from
FlowDetail.

Breaking change: this will break clients that use storage to manipulate
tasks. Clients that use engine.storage only to fetch results with
'fetch' and 'fetch_all' methods (which is the recommended way) are not
affected.

References blueprint task-executor
Co-authored-by: Ivan A. Melnikov <imelnikov@griddynamics.com>
Change-Id: Icbdb745c1ed84c5ac21c6f3a275f32c0b2939d90

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-17 14:29:29.000000000', 'message': 'Fix sqlalchemy 0.8 issues

Use import of exc instead exception.
Mutability tracking is changed in SQLAlchemy 0.8,
but it seems that sqlalchmy.types.MutableType is not needed
in classes Json and Failure from models.

Closes-bug: 1206669

Change-Id: Ib13c2575ead495b22ed5624e68e044e2f4927201
'}]
commit_message:
Fix sqlalchemy 0.8 issues

Use import of exc instead exception.
Mutability tracking is changed in SQLAlchemy 0.8,
but it seems that sqlalchmy.types.MutableType is not needed
in classes Json and Failure from models.

Closes-bug: 1206669

Change-Id: Ib13c2575ead495b22ed5624e68e044e2f4927201

commit_message:
Enable object caching in cinder REST API requests

Allow the core API to cache resources, such as DB results, so that
extensions can use data already retrieved within the same API request
eliminating additional expensive DB calls.

Loosely based on commit 9f9fbc54e7336da10fc3056bdaca2ec7d01c7f94 from
nova.

Partial-Bug: #1197612
(cherry picked from commit 233430b51ddbd207f22eee98386ffbb766fd777f)

Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/api/openstack/test_wsgi.py

Change-Id: If9f49faf7305287c0489ad6209cf19b8bec612cc

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-17 02:07:34.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for rebuild --preserve-ephemeral.

This new extension going into Nova permits preserving the ephemeral
partition during a rebuild, getting enough functionality to preserve
state - e.g. on baremetal instances - without Cinder.

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ibc4c24bb2efb82c11699231ae76e2755a753a706
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for rebuild --preserve-ephemeral.

This new extension going into Nova permits preserving the ephemeral
partition during a rebuild, getting enough functionality to preserve
state - e.g. on baremetal instances - without Cinder.

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ibc4c24bb2efb82c11699231ae76e2755a753a706

alarm.

commit_message:
Add exception logging if flow creation fails

If the create_XYZ_flow fails in being created
its useful to log exactly what the error was in
detail (instead of trapping it and only raising
a generic error). The more detailed error shows
what the real problem was during the flows
construction (which usually is some larger
problem).

Change-Id: I9cd6b8e2c6298d8791ba3063be78f9b4c4a7c5d0

commit_message:
Don't pass swift headers as None

If we set an header as None for a container swiftclient would just pass
it to httplib which convert it to string and set the None string into
it. This could not be changed in swiftclient to keep backward
compatibility lords happy so make sure that heat doesn't do that.

Closes-Bug: 1259571
Change-Id: Ida1d2cec87e44264f9a7d69a1e220b544b33b63c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-14 13:01:01.000000000', 'message': 'clean up invalid_multibyte test

This cleans up the invalid_multibyte test to make it more clear
what it is trying to do, which is send an invalid utf8 sequence as
an image name (it should fail with a 400, it currently passes with
a 202).

commit_message:
clean up invalid_multibyte test

This cleans up the invalid_multibyte test to make it more clear
what it is trying to do, which is send an invalid utf8 sequence as
an image name (it should fail with a 400, it currently passes with
a 202).

Change-Id: I58ad059a138ae96201bbf50df0c22bf259ae9716
Related-Bug: #1006725

subject: provide a valid utf8 multibyte test for nova images

commit_message:
provide a valid utf8 multibyte test for nova images

this only works for json because getting our xml client to be
fully utf8 compliant would be *a ton* of work.

Change-Id: I5e2f05274aaa6a2eb97b6206240ffd44e9f12526
Related-Bug: #1006725

'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-07-15 18:49:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

In any deployment with even a medium number of accounts, maintaining rates via conffile will rapidly become a giant mess. Keeping the proxy config up to date will be annoying *plus* you have to restart the proxy to change a single rate limit(!).

I'd suggest something like account quotas; have the rate limits set as account metadata, and then have the ratelimit middleware pull things out of the account meta, falling back to the defaults from the conf file.

You'd also want to only allow reseller_admin requests to set/modify the rate limits to stop users from just removing their limits."}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-07-16 07:04:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-16 07:59:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/37040/4/check/gate-swift-pep8/3100 : SUCCESS in 53s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/37040/4/check/gate-swift-docs/2930/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 15s
- http://logs.openstack.org/37040/4/check/gate-swift-python26/3173 : SUCCESS in 2m 20s
- http://logs.openstack.org/37040/4/check/gate-swift-python27/3176 : SUCCESS in 1m 45s
- http://logs.openstack.org/37040/4/check/gate-swift-devstack-vm-functional/22 : FAILURE in 7m 22s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/37040/4/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/32466 : SUCCESS in 54m 46s
- http://logs.openstack.org/37040/4/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-cells-full/497 : FAILURE in 15m 12s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/37040/4/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-neutron/4000 : FAILURE in 17m 14s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/37040/4/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/32158 : SUCCESS in 45m 22s
- http://logs.openstack.org/37040/4/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/18379 : FAILURE in 16m 49s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-07-16 18:56:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Don't store per-request things as instance variables in middleware. Since you end up having the same middleware object servicing many requests concurrently, anything stored in self that's per-request will get screwed up under load. For example, if you have the config file's account_ratelimit set to 50, but you set AUTH_bob's ratelimit to 25 and then PUT /v1/AUTH_bob/a-container, the limit will be 25 for everyone else from then on because the value in self.account_ratelimit will get stomped on.

Also, are you planning on doing separate container ratelimits too? The ratelimit config file lets you specify limits on container PUT/DELETE operations as well as per-container limits on object PUT/DELETE/POST requests. Well, not per-container exactly, but limits that vary with the object count within a container. It seems to me that if we're going to set rate limits per-account, we should be able to set *all* the ratelimits for that account. Just being able to override container rate limits without the object rate limits too doesn't sound particularly useful to me."}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-07-17 03:41:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

\x08Thanks for pointing out the 'self' issue :)

About your second advice, the limit on a/c/o and limit on a/c is independent with each other (if condition in get_ratelimitable_key_tuples use 'and obj' & 'and not obj'). So account_ratelimit limit the request a/c and container_ratelimit_x limit the request a/c/o without disturbing each other. I guess your meaning may be that if user sets a high individual rate on a/c and the config file sets low rate on a/c/o, we infer that the user also need a high rate on a/c/o without changing config file or changing others'ratelimit. So you prefer we do something for that infer? like giving also individual rate on a/c/o"}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-07-17 04:00:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

anther topic: 

ratelimit manages rate of requests, if using any individual limit, we have to some HEAD inside the middleware (get_account_info/get_container_info does this work), which I think is a big cost on every PUT/POST request. So we could add a setting in config file like 'individual_account_ratelimit = true'. if this is set false, we just use default limit for all accounts and avoid that cost"}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-07-17 18:08:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Calling get_account_info() isn't actually that expensive; the information is typically cached, and the proxy's object controller is going to go get that anyway (via GETorHEAD()/POST()/PUT() --> container_info() --> account_info()), so if you go get it a little earlier, that's fine.

If your testing shows that allowing individual ratelimits causes unacceptable amounts of load, then a flag to toggle it seems okay. Otherwise, I prefer to avoid such a flag; the setting of these things is already limited to reseller admins, and that should be sufficient."}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-07-18 11:22:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Work In Progress

add 'meta-ratelimit-size:rate' to support ratelimit per-container"}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-07-18 18:46:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-07-18 18:48:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Work In Progress

ratelimit on request against /account/container/object

fixes bug #735173
Change-Id: Icb18717129f189fe4eb8316f322aedd667b66b93

commit_message:
ratelimit: different rate for different account

add some features to support individual ratelimit:
1. reseller admin use 'X-Account-Meta-Ratelimit: rate' header
to set new ratelimit on request against /account/container

2. reseller admin use 'X-Container-Meta-Ratelimit-size: rate'
or 'X-Container-Meta-Ratelimit_size: rate' header to set new
ratelimit on request against /account/container/object

others:
fixes some pep9 issue in test/unit/common/middleware/test_ratelimit.py

fixes bug #735173
Change-Id: Icb18717129f189fe4eb8316f322aedd667b66b93

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-05 09:35:14.000000000', 'message': "Fixed various unit test cases for alarms

Fixed two alarm unit test issues exposed by the patch
https://review.openstack.org/59489.

1. Alarm in sqlalchemy backend DB requires foreign key contraints to
user_id/project_id. Modified the test cases to honor that.

2. We can't assume the returned items from DB are in a specific sequence
if we haven't provided sorting information to the DB.

Change-Id: Iea7ec4d6388eceba73c9294ddd3b3e437346898d
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed various unit test cases for alarms

Fixed two alarm unit test issues exposed by the patch
https://review.openstack.org/59489.

1. Alarm in sqlalchemy backend DB requires foreign key contraints to
user_id/project_id. Modified the test cases to honor that.

2. We can't assume the returned items from DB are in a specific sequence
if we haven't provided sorting information to the DB.

Change-Id: Iea7ec4d6388eceba73c9294ddd3b3e437346898d

The policy check added at api layer, that follows bp v3-api-policy.
Use 'compute:' as the scope of policy for keeping consistent with v2 api.
Also provide default policy rule 'rule:admin_or_owner' for delete action.

Partial implements bp v3-api-core-policy

Change-Id: Ie6a621942b5ae4f9ee75b4a160dbf37b518cc9c0
"}]
commit_message:
Add policy check for server's delete in v2 api

The policy check added at api layer, that follows bp v3-api-policy.
Use 'compute:' as the scope of policy for keeping consistent with v2 api.
Also provide default policy rule 'rule:admin_or_owner' for delete action.

Partial implements bp v3-api-core-policy

Change-Id: Ie6a621942b5ae4f9ee75b4a160dbf37b518cc9c0

"}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-12-10 07:36:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I think there's a few things going on here:

- This testcase won't sent an empty body because update_server_metadata will prefix what is passed as meta with metadata, so the body actually ends up being:

{metadata: {}}

which is valid.

- For the above reason I don't think this test is the cause of the LOG.error that we talked about in IRC (but I have some suspicions on where it might be, I need to look further).

- I'm pretty sure that both update_server_metadata and set_server_metadata in servers_client are actually wrong. The set_server_metadata should be doing a POST, and the update a PUT, but its backwards. 

- I'm not sure about the comment in this test. If the body value is truly empty, then yes we should be getting a badrequest and the original metadata left untouched. If its just "metadata: {}" then the original metadata should be deleted.'}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-12-10 07:44:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

ok it looks like tempest.api.compute.servers.test_server_metadata.ServerMetadataTestJSON.test_server_metadata_negative
 is the test which is the culprit which is triggering the exception logging. It does correctly verify that BadRequest is being returned. Which Nova does correctly but as discussed has the stack trace logging side effect which we don't want. And Ivans patch should fix that (but I haven't verified this)

      self.assertRaises(exceptions.BadRequest,
                          self.client.set_server_metadata,
                          self.server_id, meta=meta, no_metadata_field=True)

Although it looks like it should be calling create rather than update_all because of the problem mentioned in my previous comment it ends up calling update_all. We definitely have a tempest gap coverage here because we should have picked up that our client library was doing the wrong thing."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-12-18 06:03:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-12-18 06:03:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
test that empty body metadata request returns a 400

while we tested for behavior, we didn't test for server response,
which let a metadata server bug creep in.

Depends-on: I6ad42c9be0770278a4921045168d9a8afbe6e3c1
Related-Bug: 1242916

Change-Id: I13a98d93d517a9f6ba9a8bd1e966db30ea2697ad

While I think this is a good feature, and from a brief read through, the code looks good, I have two objections.

Firstly, baremetal is being deprecated, and so we shouldn't be adding new features. On the other hand, this is a relatively small code change, and my objection to adding it is very small.

Secondly, and more importantly, Ironic already has image caching in its PXE driver, and I would like to see the code (at least for the drivers) stay consistent so that we can track and fix bugs that affect both projects more easily. If folks feel that adding image caching to nova-baremetal is worthwhile, I would prefer that it be based on the work Ghe did in Ironic's PXE driver.

Thanks!
-Deva"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-12-10 06:03:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-29 17:49:21.000000000', 'message': 'baremetal: cache root images if possible

Previously root images are always fetched from glance for every
instance even if they use the same image. However, when file
injection is disabled (i.e. CONF.baremetal.use_file_injection is
False), the image is not changed on the compute node. So once
fetch the image, we can cache it for later reuse. It reduces the
download time and disk usage of the compute node.

Images are downloaded to a directory managed by imagechache
(e.g. /var/lib/nova/instances/_base/) rather than one for each
instance (e.g. /var/lib/nova/instances/$instance-name/).
A symbolic link is created in the instance directory instead.

Now baremetal.utils.cache_image() needs a lock since it can be
called for the same target path at the same time.

Change-Id: I1c14a9a257f0dc7f1b30956017b11db2aee5474c
'}]
commit_message:
baremetal: cache root images if possible

Previously root images are always fetched from glance for every
instance even if they use the same image. However, when file
injection is disabled (i.e. CONF.baremetal.use_file_injection is
False), the image is not changed on the compute node. So once
fetch the image, we can cache it for later reuse. It reduces the
download time and disk usage of the compute node.

Images are downloaded to a directory managed by imagechache
(e.g. /var/lib/nova/instances/_base/) rather than one for each
instance (e.g. /var/lib/nova/instances/$instance-name/).
A symbolic link is created in the instance directory instead.

Now baremetal.utils.cache_image() needs a lock since it can be
called for the same target path at the same time.

Change-Id: I1c14a9a257f0dc7f1b30956017b11db2aee5474c

'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-11-15 19:11:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

We generally do not accept code in tempest that cannot be run. This bug was filed more than a year ago and seemed to generate a log of different opinions including some that it should not be fixed at all. What would be different about an "individual environment" that would let the test run there but not in the gate?'}, {'account_id': 8859, 'date': '2013-11-20 07:33:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I did not know the principle which does not accept code that cannot be run. However, this test can run in almost every case while it might not work without fail. Therefore, it is not appropriate that this test case is used for gate job in OpenStack development, but it must be useful for functional tests of deployed cluster.'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-11-20 22:12:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Unless I am missing something, this test will not run because in devstack the object-expirer does not run at all. If it ran every 10s then this test could work by waiting for the object to disappear for a certain amount of time just like we wait for server instances to be created, etc. If tests like this take too long then a "slow swift" job could be added to run such tests as is being done for heat.'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-11-20 22:23:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

so skip is really for us turning off working tests when the underlying project becomes too unreliable to run them.

This really seems like you want to actually do a feature skip on the expiration working. Then we need to figure out if there is a way to set up the gate to test this, or have someone else report back results.'}, {'account_id': 8859, 'date': '2013-11-28 02:25:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks for comments, David and Sean. I did not know that object-expirer daemon is not running in devstack environment, therefore my opinion was not pertinent. 
However, as far as Swift officially supports this feature, I believe it is necessary to test functionally by some ways (if possible, in the gate job).
Therefore I try to figure out how to set up the gate for testing object expiry feature. However, I am a newbie who starts committing to the tempest from a month ago, so I need to learn other QA features from now. Could you let me know some references?'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-11-28 12:37:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Look at https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/api/compute/servers/test_server_actions.py#L153 for an example of how we skip on a specific feature being available, and how that gets set in tempest. I think a similar approach could be taken here."}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-12-04 18:26:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I wonder if it is simply a bug that object-expirer is not running. It was a feature that was added in a recent release and perhaps devstack was simply not updated with its config. The log shows that object-expirer config is missing as the reason it is not running.'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-12-06 18:19:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The referenced bug ticket shows mounting sentiment that it is not going to be fixed but accepted as "expected behavior".'}, {'account_id': 8859, 'date': '2013-12-10 07:51:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks, Sean and David. Now this feature is not a bug but a specification. I think there are three possible solutions for this issue.

1. Adding skipif annotation on test cases, and setting default availability of object expirer as False. This is very simple, but these tests can not be done in the gate job.

2. Adding skipif annotation, and setting default availability as True. And, modifying Devstack to run object-expirer. But, default interval of object-expirer is too long (300 sec.), so devstack replaces default interval with short time (< 10 sec.)

3. Without modifying default interval in Devstack, creating other gate job like "gate-slow-swift" to check object-expirer feature. 


Solution 2 seems more suitable in this case. We cannot test the feature of object-expirer in Solution 1 and Solution 3 seems somewhat grandiose. What do you think?'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-12-18 06:03:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-12-18 06:03:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-14 01:07:48.000000000', 'message': "Add X-Delete-At parameter test to Swift object expiry test

Add a test of object expiry feature by X-Delete-At HTTP request
header, not just X-Delete-After header.

Note: This test is skipped because of Swift's bug 1069849 by default.
But, this test will be helpful to test present state of object expiry
functions in individual environment.

Change-Id: I647915fcfff606892a4642cc5023d65803d5e8a9
Closes-Bug: #1240829
"}]
commit_message:
Add X-Delete-At parameter test to Swift object expiry test

Add a test of object expiry feature by X-Delete-At HTTP request
header, not just X-Delete-After header.

Note: This test is skipped because of Swift's bug 1069849 by default.
But, this test will be helpful to test present state of object expiry
functions in individual environment.

Change-Id: I647915fcfff606892a4642cc5023d65803d5e8a9
Closes-Bug: #1240829

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-29 07:43:49.000000000', 'message': "Add code for support dhcp_mode in neutronClient

Code change for support subnet new attribute 'dhcp_mode' in
neutronClient. The code change depends on code change #52983,
so the unit test code need to be added after change #52983

Add code for support dhcp mode in neutronClient

Code change for support subnet new attribute 'dhcp_modes' in
neutronClient. The code change depends on
Change-Id:I5b2313fff5dca1c16ff939fdc4397d7f95ba3ba5

commit_message:
Update glance/openstack/common from oslo Part 1

Update glance/openstack/common files from oslo
except glance/openstack/common/rpc and
glance/openstack/common/crypto.

Oslo commit: 764ad35e89d20008bf48d17e4129cfce5b717a6c

'}, {'created': '2013-12-09 21:06:57.000000000', 'message': "fix dispatch issue to metadata server update_all

if you make a metadata server update_all requests with no body,
you never actually make it down to metadata server update_all's
update code, as it breaks on a function signature one level up.
This has a nasty side effect of dumping an error in the logs, and
yet returning a 200 to the user (because of where this is caught).

The following fix makes the body parameter have a default value,
thus letting the extension handle the error itself and correctly
return the 400 we are expecting. Added unit testing to ensure that
we don't regress this.

There is also a tempest change waiting in the wings to enforce the
behavior at the tempest layer.

Needed-by: I13a98d93d517a9f6ba9a8bd1e966db30ea2697ad
Fixes-Bug: 1242916

Change-Id: I6ad42c9be0770278a4921045168d9a8afbe6e3c1
"}]
commit_message:
fix dispatch issue to metadata server update_all

if you make a metadata server update_all requests with no body,
you never actually make it down to metadata server update_all's
update code, as it breaks on a function signature one level up.
This has a nasty side effect of dumping an error in the logs, and
yet returning a 200 to the user (because of where this is caught).

The following fix makes the body parameter have a default value,
thus letting the extension handle the error itself and correctly
return the 400 we are expecting. Added unit testing to ensure that
we don't regress this.

There is also a tempest change waiting in the wings to enforce the
behavior at the tempest layer.

Needed-by: I13a98d93d517a9f6ba9a8bd1e966db30ea2697ad
Fixes-Bug: 1242916

Change-Id: I6ad42c9be0770278a4921045168d9a8afbe6e3c1

Obviously a WIP - but seems to be a complete duplicate of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/51523

I understand there has been some mix up with the blueprints for this - so I hope that gets cleared up on the mailing list - but we really don't need two copies of the same thing. Don't do this to prove a point.

Not a -2 because I do have a technical question though:
This finds the 'root' models (the ones that foreign keys pointing to them, maybe an unfortunate name) and then relies on cascade deletes to delete the linked rows.

- This does not work for postgres that easily if I remember correctly.

- Even if it does - why do we bother cleaning up the children when we are going to drop them anyway?

Also - string interpolation for queries = Bleauh!"}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-11-20 13:01:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Benchmark scenarios for Rally: Nova floating IPs

The patch provides Rally with the basic set of Nova benchmark scenarios for
floating IPs: these include creating/deleting a bunch of floating IPs and
assigning floating IPs to a server.

Blueprint benchmark-scenarios

Change-Id: I783091574b67e9a0e3758ca934e82f8bf48afa3a

commit_message:
Working on models refactoring

Refactor models to use __slots__ for attribute values.
This should have following benefits:
    * reduce overall memory usage
    * allow better field validation

Change-Id: Ie2c371db9a00a0185ed140c21c74d90b1d77ae02

This seems to be code that is common for all of the drivers - unless the actual driver needs to do something - it does not look like the libvirt code actual does anything driver specific. Please see - https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py#L2676

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-10 00:52:51.000000000', 'message': 'VMWare: Enable set_host_enabled for ESXDriver

When runs "nova host-update" with a ESXDriver, nova client will
report exception. This is because of set_host_enabled API need a
return value of host status (enabled or disabled), but ESXDriver
does not return this value.

This patch was enabling ESXDriver return host status when
set_host_enabled was called.

Change-Id: If479c590f7de3027f6c6af4f9cb2c9f0c4380b84
Closes-Bug: #1258767
'}]
commit_message:
VMWare: Enable set_host_enabled for ESXDriver

When runs "nova host-update" with a ESXDriver, nova client will
report exception. This is because of set_host_enabled API need a
return value of host status (enabled or disabled), but ESXDriver
does not return this value.

This patch was enabling ESXDriver return host status when
set_host_enabled was called.

Change-Id: If479c590f7de3027f6c6af4f9cb2c9f0c4380b84
Closes-Bug: #1258767

commit_message:
Replace inheritance hierarchy with composition

In the process of unification of the clients code we should use
composition to allow easier replacement with common HTTPClient.

bp common-client-library-2

Change-Id: I318285e1f0cb55e9d3041b203eee80f90be104ca

commit_message:
Modify tests to run with auth-plugins

Modify tests so that all client tests are run against both the original
client method and the new auth plugins method. There is some scaffolding
introduced to handle the differences between the two methods.

Change-Id: If7e60b72ff309cbd958ea590ff655fcfab1800bb
blueprint: auth-plugins

commit_message:
Enable data locality for HDP plugin

Enabled the savanna data locality features for the HDP plugin.  The
HDP plugin makes use of the topology_helper to create the required
configuration for rack awareness.  This initial implementation assumes
that enabling the feature for the server implies that all clusters
will leverage the capability.

Implementes blueprint hdp-support-data-locality

Change-Id: I12bc5c064baff36c9630a4c48128f97c014fd537

[{'created': '2013-12-17 13:04:46.000000000', 'message': 'Add member to LBaaS when no servers available always succeed

Adding a member to a LBaaS pool when there are no servers
available it shows a "Success: Added member(s)." message.
Also, when there are no servers available, the message says
"Click Add to cancel" which is wrong from the UX perspective.
This patch makes the members field required in order to avoid
succeeding when cero members are added and changes the message
to be more representative.

Change-Id: I5c68b2cc8c5e457aeadee11711d36c802410f08d
Closes-Bug: #1260359
'}]
commit_message:
Add member to LBaaS when no servers available always succeed

Adding a member to a LBaaS pool when there are no servers
available it shows a "Success: Added member(s)." message.
Also, when there are no servers available, the message says
"Click Add to cancel" which is wrong from the UX perspective.
This patch makes the members field required in order to avoid
succeeding when cero members are added and changes the message
to be more representative.

Change-Id: I5c68b2cc8c5e457aeadee11711d36c802410f08d
Closes-Bug: #1260359

[{'created': '2013-12-17 11:53:49.000000000', 'message': "Gracefully handle Users with no email attribute

In certain environments, such as when using Keystone with a LDAP
backend, it's possible that the email attribute won't exist for all
users.

Change-Id: I71041be832206e52bfb73926199f2c89e0e84a0b
Closes-Bug: #1260423
"}]
commit_message:
Gracefully handle Users with no email attribute

In certain environments, such as when using Keystone with a LDAP
backend, it's possible that the email attribute won't exist for all
users.

Change-Id: I71041be832206e52bfb73926199f2c89e0e84a0b
Closes-Bug: #1260423

commit_message:
barematal: Cleanup the calls to assertEqual

Switch the ordering of assertEqual calls to match the correct
(expected, observed) ordering. This makes test failures easier to read.

Change-Id: Iecad55e33be4ab8f7ddff3b4cdbe08aa6c1b8660
Partial-Bug: #1260134

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-17 02:40:41.000000000', 'message': "Permit setting the overcloud image update policy.

This is needed to preserve /mnt when rebuilding nodes. In principle we
can do stateful updates with rolling migrations etc - this is just
much quicker and is the path we have agreed on for getting out of the
quagmire we're in where noone can use use for production image based
updates.

Change-Id: I0efa8f52864f49ccdb885f6f655c732c951b3f7a
"}, {'created': '2013-12-17 07:49:00.000000000', 'message': "Permit setting the overcloud image update policy.

This is needed to preserve /mnt when rebuilding nodes. In principle we
can do stateful updates with rolling heat stack updates and live
migrations of tenants, cinder data and swift data - but that is a lot
of overhead to use every time - this is just much quicker and is the
path we have agreed on for getting out of the quagmire we're in where
no-one can use us for production image based updates.

Change-Id: I0efa8f52864f49ccdb885f6f655c732c951b3f7a
"}, {'created': '2013-12-17 22:15:35.000000000', 'message': "Permit setting the overcloud image update policy.

This is needed to preserve /mnt when rebuilding nodes. In principle we
can do stateful updates with rolling heat stack updates and live
migrations of tenants, cinder data and swift data - but that is a lot
of overhead to use every time - this is just much quicker and is the
path we have agreed on for getting out of the quagmire we're in where
no-one can use us for production image based updates.

commit_message:
Permit setting the overcloud image update policy.

This is needed to preserve /mnt when rebuilding nodes. In principle we
can do stateful updates with rolling heat stack updates and live
migrations of tenants, cinder data and swift data - but that is a lot
of overhead to use every time - this is just much quicker and is the
path we have agreed on for getting out of the quagmire we're in where
no-one can use us for production image based updates.

Change-Id: I0efa8f52864f49ccdb885f6f655c732c951b3f7a

commit_message:
Preserve the overcloud rather than deleting it.

Users can delete it if they want, but updating should be the default,
because who wants to throw away a cloud on every run!

Change-Id: I3486640fc29d12f5ffdb50d6873dcb8272376ef7

commit_message:
Return 204 when image data does not exist

Currently a GET on image-data in glance v2 returns 404 when data does not
exist. But according to the API docs the HTTP status code returned in this
case should be 204.

This fix makes Glance return the right HTTP status code.

Change-Id: I34cf68e96f631f05cff349329245f74aee42397c
Closes-Bug: #1251055

commit_message:
Add metadata query validation limitation

There is currently no way to pre-determine the schema of
resource_metadata. So it will be hard to validate when
running a query. This patch includes this limitation in
ceilometer documentation.

Change-Id: I804467c3bb8e7d336ae881b25434063839951724
Partial-Bug: #1245367

'}, {'account_id': 9173, 'date': '2013-12-08 17:33:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

As far as I understand the rebuild/recreation feature it does nothing more then destroying the current instance and creating it again with another images (or same image if selected). The rebuild/recreate keeps the previously allocated ip addresses and uuid.

That should be possible with docker, not sure why we should disable it.'}, {'account_id': 6722, 'date': '2013-12-09 02:27:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yes,
rebuild is supported by some hypervisors. Flag supports_recreate is used for evacuate. 
These are some information about evacuate function:
 https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Evacuate
 https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/rebuild-for-ha
 http://docs.openstack.org/grizzly/openstack-compute/admin/content//nova_cli_evacuate.html

Maybe need add Docker expert here :)'}, {'account_id': 9173, 'date': '2013-12-09 19:39:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks for sharing the links.
I believe docker falls in the "ephemeral instance" category.
As far as I understood will a regular "ephemeral instance" just restarted on another host machine with the same identity (e.g. same ID, flavor, IP).

This use case should be possible with docker if ignore for a second that docker has a own internal network where the IP address will definitely different. If that is bad depends on the application which is running inside the container.

Obviously testing is needed :)'}, {'account_id': 6722, 'date': '2013-12-15 06:40:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6722, 'date': '2013-12-15 06:52:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-12-15 06:52:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2013-12-18 02:18:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

I had to dig a bit into the compute manager to determine which virt driver method needed to be implemented for the evacuate operation and that's 'instance_on_disk', which the docker driver doesn't implement. 'has_imagecache' is a bit more obvious, the driver method is 'manage_image_cache' which the docker driver doesn't implement either.

As for removing the capabilities dict altogether versus setting the values to False, the base class sets them to False (that's why the tests pass without a KeyError):

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/driver.py#L128

It seems a bit odd to me that we have a capabilities dict like this in the virt driver rather than simply calling the method and handling a NotImplementedError, that seems more 'pythonic' to me, but I don't know the full history on this either."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-18 02:18:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: No score

commit_message:
Remove docker's unsupported capabilities

The 'supports_recreate' flag needs the driver to support the evacuate
operation. The 'has_imagecache' flag needs the driver to implement the
'manage_image_cache' method. Docker does not currently support these
two functions, so the capabilities flags should not be set.

Partial-Bug: #1261636

Change-Id: I191d0d8cd35aece52462c0477f2d89897bb762c1

The scheduler utility method for building a request_spec could be passed
an instance dict or instance object.  The jsonutils.to_primitive call on
the request_spec dict serializes an instance object but should not be
relied upon because it uses an interface on the object that may go away.
Instead, an object should be serialized properly before going into the

Change-Id: I9d810a0b8ee6f1beb79d831053f4bbd12b761b0b

The scheduler utility method for building a request_spec could be passed
an instance dict or instance object.  The jsonutils.to_primitive call on
the request_spec dict serializes an instance object but should not be

request_spec.

Change-Id: I9d810a0b8ee6f1beb79d831053f4bbd12b761b0b
'}]
commit_message:
Serialize instance object while building request_spec

The scheduler utility method for building a request_spec could be passed
an instance dict or instance object.  The jsonutils.to_primitive call on
the request_spec dict serializes an instance object but should not be
relied upon because it uses an interface on the object that may go away.
Instead, an object should be serialized properly before going into the
request_spec.

Change-Id: I9d810a0b8ee6f1beb79d831053f4bbd12b761b0b

commit_message:
Automatic login after password changed

Currently when a user changed the password successfully,
it will redirect to the login page, the user needs to
input the username and new password to relogin. This will
allow user to automatic login after password changed.

Fixes bug 1252130

Change-Id: I34a8fcda1ef2d93c62c16d5d9a3d5461e9237ee0

commit_message:
Reworks Chassis validations

This makes use of complex types validations of WSME that now works.

Change-Id: I5cd46d5c2caeb3f3c4cd1ef90448e7fd3c81404d
Closes-Bug: #1223847

It seems that it is attempting to solve a similar problem, but it conflicts with yours..."}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2013-11-28 08:35:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I think Edward's fix is much cleaner and less impact to the rest of Cinder."}, {'account_id': 8574, 'date': '2013-11-28 09:09:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I also prefer to accommodate Edwards code change.'}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2013-11-28 09:21:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

It's much easier just to make this decision in the flow itself since it affects all drivers afaict. That way we don't have to worry modify all drivers and tests. See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/58893/"}, {'account_id': 8787, 'date': '2013-12-02 21:01:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I agree that Edwards patch is cleaner since it doesn't have to pass additional information into the driver, but I'm not yet convinced that a blanket no-clone decision is applicable to all backends (also see the comments on Edward's change). Just in case, I've forwarded this discussion to openstack-dev:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-December/020881.html"}, {'account_id': 8787, 'date': '2013-12-03 17:11:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2013-12-03 17:12:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Automatically re-added by Gerrit trivial rebase detection script."}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2013-12-03 17:17:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

HZ>I think Edward's fix is much cleaner and less impact to the rest of Cinder.

I have to disagree... the other fix rules out the ability for drivers to do things like efficient qcow2->qcow2 copies.  This needs to be handled at the driver level rather than as a single rule in the manager/flow.

Still looking at this patch, but I think it's going the right direction."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-03 18:07:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 7689, 'date': '2013-12-03 22:22:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

Each driver should be responsible for determining if an image can be cloned.  Is it possible to do that in all cases with existing arguments passed to clone_image?'}, {'account_id': 1107, 'date': '2013-12-03 22:54:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

It would involve duplicating a bunch of logic from libvirt (the c library, not the nova driver) for rbd to construct an appropriate qemu-img command line to figure out the format of the image. It's much easier to add a single new parameter to the clone_image method."}, {'account_id': 5538, 'date': '2013-12-04 06:03:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2013-12-04 06:10:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Josh, the method for determining the format is image_utils.qemu_img_info.

All, I have no problem adding the extra parameter.  The question is if we can trust the format that the user provided to Glance?  I would recommend running qemu_img_info as a sanity check either way."}, {'account_id': 8787, 'date': '2013-12-04 08:29:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Avishay, if we don't trust the image format provided by user to Glance, the right place to validate it is in Glance, before it is written into its database. By the time this information is passed to a Cinder driver, the question is not whether we can trust the user, it is whether we can trust Glance to validate that information, and whether we can trust libvirt and KVM to not fail badly when presented with an unexpected volume format."}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2013-12-04 12:56:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: No score

Avishay, you can't verify the image format unless you have a local copy to run qemu-img on, which is not an option in this case.

Dimitry, see my updated patchset. It is essentially functionally equivalent to yours now. The main difference is the mock unit tests. If you want you can copy the tests or you can go with my patchset instead up to you."}, {'account_id': 8787, 'date': '2013-12-04 18:35:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Edward, I like your expanded unit test, but I'd like to keep the rest of my patch. For one, I think passing the whole image_meta dictionary instead of just format is more future-proof and may spare us more refactoring down the road. There are reasonable cases where a driver would want to factor other image parameters besides format into the decision whether to clone it, e.g. size. I'm going to borrow your unit test changes and see how that works."}, {'account_id': 8787, 'date': '2013-12-04 20:53:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-04 22:00:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

commit_message:
Do not clone non-raw images in rbd backend

RBD backend only supports booting from images in raw format. A volume
that was cloned from an image in any other format is not bootable. The
RBD driver will consider non-raw images to be uncloneable to trigger
automatic conversion to raw format.

Includes conversion of the corresponding unit test to use mock (instead
of mox) and expanded comments and error messages based on change #58893
by Edward Hope-Morley.

Change-Id: I5725d2f7576bc1b3e9b874ba944ad17d33a6e2cb
Closes-Bug: #1246219
Closes-Bug: #1247998

commit_message:
Add OS::Neutron::RouterL3Agent for router.py

This resource supports part of "agent management and scheduler
extensions" in Neutron. It associates router with l3-agent.

see related-bug: #1245366

Closes-bug: #1259845
Change-Id: I781645e62beb4fe60e064d61ad298834e551142d

commit_message:
Fix and enable gating on H402

Summary docstrings should end with punctuation.
Also changed it to command-style in a few places.

Change-Id: Id94fe995aa05356106ad09899b0ada27d608ff21

doing that manually if someone hasn't already. For a code review
which is not yet approved, you can recheck by leaving a code
review comment with just the text:

    recheck bug 1257641

you can reverify by leaving a comment like this:

commit_message:
Stop Neutron advanced service external processes

Some of Neutron advanced services (LBaaS, VPNaaS, ....) creates
external processes and they should be stopped in unstack.
This commit defines neutron_<XaaS>_stop functions for all services
and implements the cleanup logics if necessary.

Also cleanup_neutron removes netns used by LBaaS haproxy.

Change-Id: Ied3a2c374ffcb6b59ecaf1027fb6e6083eded2ae

[{'created': '2013-12-17 05:30:02.000000000', 'message': 'Match RHEL Beta release strings

RHEL7 (in beta) has "Beta" after the release number and before the
code-name.  Add a number-match to the regex so everything between that
match and the codename in parenthesis is considered the release.

Change-Id: I992f20eedcefc6aeed6bd3ad57fc4cf20c8ef15d
'}]
commit_message:
Match RHEL Beta release strings

RHEL7 (in beta) has "Beta" after the release number and before the
code-name.  Add a number-match to the regex so everything between that
match and the codename in parenthesis is considered the release.

Change-Id: I992f20eedcefc6aeed6bd3ad57fc4cf20c8ef15d

We could fix installing of templates first."}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2013-12-09 17:13:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"make overcloud.yaml" doesn't seem to work after this change:

 $ make overcloud.yaml
# overcloud-source.yaml nova-compute-instance.yaml swift-source.yaml won't work here because we want to list nova-compute-instance.yaml as
# a prerequisite but don't want to pass it into merge.py
python ./tripleo_heat_merge/merge.py overcloud-source.yaml swift-source.yaml > overcloud.yaml.tmp
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./tripleo_heat_merge/merge.py", line 224, in <module>
    main()
  File "./tripleo_heat_merge/merge.py", line 90, in main
    merged_template = merge(templates, args.master_role, args.slave_roles)
  File "./tripleo_heat_merge/merge.py", line 167, in merge
    with open(rbody['Path']) as rfile:
IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: './tripleo_heat_merge/nova-compute-instance.yaml'
make: *** [overcloud.yaml] Error 1

I'm not sure if that what's the comment is telling me in the Makefile (line 2 and 3) or not.

This would affect the devtest_overcloud.sh script won't it when it calls make?

merge.py seems to expect that the source yaml files it needs are in the same directory as merge.py itself.'}, {'account_id': 8399, 'date': '2013-12-09 20:05:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Same, make isn't running for me either.

My guess is the reverence in overcloud-source.yaml:

  NovaCompute0Config:
    Type: FileInclude
    Path: nova-compute-instance.yaml

At 165 in merge.py, that's called with open(). With this change that merge.py is in tripleo_heat_merge, this file is no longer found in the same directory and bombs."}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-12-09 23:01:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Changing my vote as the problems outlined have convinced me that this needs rethinking.

Also I think we need to build everything as part of the gate and run the tests.

If we weren't just limping along until HOT has software config I'd suggest putting this in its own repository at this point. If we are still limping in a month, I may do that anyway."}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-12-10 02:11:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

(1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2013-12-10 15:41:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Roman: right - this no longer installs the templates themselves but only the merge.py script. I'm not convinced either way which is the best approach.

Installing the templates will break tooling (devtest scripts) because we would need to tell them where the templates are (and in fact, devtest scripts use 'make' so we would need to install the Makefile too...? ). Also, due to limitations with pbr and the pattern matching for template files, including the templates in the setup.cfg would make this all much harder to maintain (share/tripleo-heat-templates/templates = *.yaml doesn't work, we would need to list them all individually).

WRT the issue that James reports - indeed, this is something I had in mind to fix with another review but since it's come up here lets discuss. As Jay points out, the problem here is that overcloud-source.yaml is referencing another template with the 'FileInclude' directive. Since this relative path *expected* to be in the same directory as the merge script there is a coupling between where the merge.py script and the templates live. IMO this is a problem. It *could* be fixed in a couple of ways:

* make paths in templates absolute (this is what I'm doing in I578b4e9f238590ea245b827bc75d252568d194fe)
* add a templates_dir parameter to merge.py so we can look for templates when there is a problem
* ?

thoughts/suggestions welcome. I think for this particular case I'd go with adding a templates directory parameter (that defaults to None... afaics overcloud-source.yaml is the only one that includes in this way right now).

thanks! marios"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-12-11 07:50:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

We could pass merge.py a list of paths to look for templates in, but as a quick solution I'd just make it look relative to $CWD:

 -                #make sure rbody['Path'] is absolute - required when this
 -                #script invoked by import rather than command line
 -                if os.path.dirname(rbody['Path']) == '':
 -                    template_dir = os.path.dirname(__file__)
 -                    filename = rbody['Path']
 -                    rbody['Path'] = os.path.join(template_dir, filename)
 +                # Resolve relative rbody['Path'] to our CWD
 +                if not os.path.isabs(rbody['Path']):
 +                    rbody['Path'] = os.path.join(os.getcwd(), rbody['Path'])


Packaging and installing the template files is something that can be addressed as a later commit IMO"}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2013-12-13 11:45:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Finally getting to move this forward today. 

@Mark: trouble is that once installed at /usr/lib/python2.7... as a package os.getcwd() resolves to *that* path. From irc discussion with spamaps, rpodolyaka and slagle seems that the directory approach is palatable enough for now; I'll open a separate review for that and let this one hang until that lands."}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2013-12-13 12:27:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

@Mark: since we are trying to fix this for the Makefile (i.e. "make overcloud.yaml") indeed getcwd() would work, resolving to wherever the makefile is (and the templates).'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2013-12-13 13:10:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I220c5e52d8062e98aa28a1c582e29c7e844bc9ae adds the included-template-path param (defaulting to ./). Once/if that lands I can rebase on this and the makefile problem goes away.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2013-12-17 13:54:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-17 13:54:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

commit_message:
Make merge.py installable as a package using pbr

Now that merge.py is invokable from another script
(Ia6b6416fe10358d23f2b120283eecaf4c1178cfd) and from comments at that
review, it makes sense to offer a nicer way to consume the merge
functionality.

Once you git clone tripleo-heat-templates you can python setup.py
install and get /usr/bin/tripleo_heat_merge as well as a
tripleo_heat_merge package in python2.7/site-packages.

Makefile edits required because we moved merge.py into the
tripleo_heat_merge directory for the packaging.

Change-Id: I587fa7a826f93f89e8e5c266af7f5765438fe738

commit_message:
Create network-utils element

Creates a new network-utils element which currently contains a
single utility that can be used to create an ovs bridge. This is
being split out from init-neutron-ovs so that it can be used as a
stand alone script in ci.

Change-Id: I8c7bc6bb9db3417811d567a48b6b3a2c628f5ccd

commit_message:
Neutron: make logging configurable...

Adds top level neutron.debug and neutron.verbose config parameters
to control Neutron logging.

The motivation for this change is so that we can more easily
control the log level of Neutron. For production our default log
level is still WARN, and for CI we'll be able to easily increase
the level to DEBUG.

Change-Id: I6e02be47db485037fe2a28cb30f0c7253affc20c

commit_message:
Add a diskimage-builder script that creates an Ubuntu 13.04 image.

Implements: blueprint lang-pack-examples

* Work Item: Define a disk image builder template for a base Ubuntu Python 3.3
system - Ubuntu 13.04 includes cloud-init and python 3.3 so no additional
diskimage-builder elements are needed.

Change-Id: Ib785bc7131b4c9d435dee9289e7fcc68509d195a

subject: Make rebuild use Instance objects

The instance['uuid'] cleanup can happen globally later (this isn't the only place that needs it).

Passing an instance object to driver.get_info should be safe, it's not the first time that we've passed instance objects to driver methods, they shouldn't be doing anything heavy with it like passing over rpc calls.

And giving comstud's +2 on the cells stuff weight for my +2 since I'm not really familiar with it."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-13 21:45:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: No score

commit_message:
Make rebuild use Instance objects

This makes the rebuild operation use Instance objects through to
the compute manager. It was already taking them from the rebuild
API code, but converting it to a dict almost immediately, before
it got passed to anything else. This cleans that up and makes it
native.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects

Change-Id: I46430af3a52f4fe2f8c2e3c2d654cd8eb0fa1662

I will add the client_exception decorator in a separate review. [{'created': '2013-12-17 16:20:13.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent tempest from failing upon ActionInProgress

Jenkins occasionally fails in the 'check-tempest-dsvm-postgres-full'
test.  The tempest tests sometimes try to delete the same stack twice
and an ActionInProgress exception is raised.  This results in ERROR
messages in the log file, which causes the tempest test to fail.

The fix is to decorate the StackLock.acquire method with
client_exceptions, which "allows the declaration of expected exceptions
that the RPC layer should not consider fatal, and not log as if they
were generated in a real error scenario."

Closes-Bug: #1261433
Change-Id: I0692b9d5cf03501ba532b40abf4e567134cda057
'}, {'created': '2013-12-17 16:56:37.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent tempest from failing upon ActionInProgress

Jenkins occasionally fails in the 'check-tempest-dsvm-postgres-full'
test.  The tempest tests sometimes try to delete the same stack twice
and an ActionInProgress exception is raised.  This results in ERROR
messages in the log file, which causes the tempest test to fail.

The fix is to decorate the StackLock.acquire method with
client_exceptions, which "allows the declaration of expected exceptions
that the RPC layer should not consider fatal, and not log as if they
were generated in a real error scenario."

Closes-Bug: #1261433
Change-Id: I0692b9d5cf03501ba532b40abf4e567134cda057
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent tempest from failing upon ActionInProgress

Jenkins occasionally fails in the 'check-tempest-dsvm-postgres-full'
test.  The tempest tests sometimes try to delete the same stack twice
and an ActionInProgress exception is raised.  This results in ERROR
messages in the log file, which causes the tempest test to fail.

The fix is to decorate the StackLock.acquire method with
client_exceptions, which "allows the declaration of expected exceptions
that the RPC layer should not consider fatal, and not log as if they
were generated in a real error scenario."

Closes-Bug: #1261433
Change-Id: I0692b9d5cf03501ba532b40abf4e567134cda057

This patch added 2 command line parameters -debug-host and -debug-port
which are used to connect to an external debugger such as pycharm or eclipse.
This feature is used when you want to connect to a nova service via a
debugger running on a different host.  To use it you start the nova service
with --debug-host <where the debugger is running> --debug-port <port it's
listening on>.  This can also be in nova.conf and would go into the DEFAULT
section.  The default is None as you normally do not connect to a debugger
when running in production.  In order to allow the remote debugger to work
with monkey_patching, you need to set the GEVENT_SUPPORT to True on the
client side. On the server side, gevent enabled debugging should also
be set.

Change-Id: I6ede9bf0813eafbeb91d858c297d4c160aafceba

commit_message:
Enable remote debugging for nova

This patch added 2 command line parameters which are used to
connect to an external debugger such as pycharm or eclipse.
This feature is used when you want to connect to a nova
service via a debugger running on a different host.
To use it you start the nova service with  the following
command line parameters

--remote_debug-host <where the debugger is running>
--remote_debug-port <port> it's listening on>.

DocImpact
Closes-bug: #1251021
Change-Id: I6ede9bf0813eafbeb91d858c297d4c160aafceba

Update to get jsonutils compatible with Python 3.

The babel Python module is now required by gettextutils, and gettextutils is
imported by excutils.

Change-Id: Ifa6d6b29e2af58dfcfda1ab7efdb2f32cf9de655
'}]
commit_message:
sysnchronize oslo-incubator modules

Update to get jsonutils compatible with Python 3.

The babel Python module is now required by gettextutils, and gettextutils is
imported by excutils.

Change-Id: Ifa6d6b29e2af58dfcfda1ab7efdb2f32cf9de655

commit_message:
Remove unused oslo-incubator modules

rootwrap and config/generator are more server oriented modules
and for sure unused in a client.

Change-Id: Idc46352fa26a6f4b87ef2ad97d2bd86758c1a0eb

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-06 16:40:47.000000000', 'message': 'Rename nodes/<uuid>/state to nodes/<uuid>/states

The commit https://review.openstack.org/#/c/60299 refactored the /state
subresource of nodes in the Ironic API and one of the changes made was
to rename the subresource from /state to /states (plural) since now both
power and provision state can be retrieved in one request call.

Change-Id: I3e3cf29fa0fd48063ae0ca14eac6f685ccc44e65
'}, {'created': '2013-12-11 10:58:55.000000000', 'message': 'Rename nodes/<uuid>/state to nodes/<uuid>/states

The commit https://review.openstack.org/#/c/60299 refactored the /state
subresource of nodes in the Ironic API and one of the changes made was

commit_message:
Rename nodes/<uuid>/state to nodes/<uuid>/states

The commit https://review.openstack.org/#/c/60299 refactored the /state
subresource of nodes in the Ironic API and one of the changes made was
to rename the subresource from /state to /states (plural) since now both
power and provision state can be retrieved in one request call.

Change-Id: I3e3cf29fa0fd48063ae0ca14eac6f685ccc44e65

"}, {'account_id': 8091, 'date': '2013-12-16 19:03:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

"Trevor, how long will we keep 'Jar' action name in the code? What do you think?"

Well, we have a release out there now, so conceivably someone might have a savanna database with "Jar" jobs stored, and more may be added.

I would say leave the compatibility code in for 1 release (the first release that contains this change) with a release note that says "Deprecated".  That will allow people to migrate any Jar jobs to MapReduce, or change any scripts they might have written.  Then remove it in the following release.

We could also provide a utility script that passes over a savanna db and changes all "Jar" job types to "MapReduce".  That would require minimal effort on the part of users to drop "Jar"'}, {'account_id': 8091, 'date': '2013-12-16 19:15:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hmm, having second thoughts on how I implemented this.  I think it may be better to make "Jar" and "MapReduce" synonyms everywhere, and force newly created jobs to have type "MapReduce".  This would make testing easier...

if job.type in ["Jar", "MapReduce"]....'}, {'account_id': 8411, 'date': '2013-12-16 21:37:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-13 18:41:25.000000000', 'message': 'Change "Jar" job type to "MapReduce"

Changes the "Jar" job type to "MapReduce".  This maps more closely
to the underlying Oozie actions, and will help remove ambiguity when
Savanna supports Oozie "java" actions in the future.

Backward compatibility is supported as follows:
1) Any job created through the REST api with job type "Jar" will
have its job type automatically changed to "MapReduce"

2) Attempts to run jobs in an existing Savanna database that have
a job type of "Jar" will be allowed.

3) Attempts to retrieve config hints for job type "Jar" will return
the config hints for "MapReduce"

These measures should allow this change to work with a UI which is
still using the "Jar" job type.

Closes-Bug #1260829

Change-Id: I1ad59fa466b9a5d838c62bf366b642e453340bce
'}, {'created': '2013-12-16 22:15:08.000000000', 'message': 'Change "Jar" job type to "MapReduce"

Changes the "Jar" job type to "MapReduce".  This maps more closely
to the underlying Oozie actions, and will help remove ambiguity when
Savanna supports Oozie "java" actions in the future.

Backward compatibility is supported as follows:
1) Any job created through the conductor with job type "Jar" will
have its job type automatically changed to "MapReduce"

2) Tests for job_type "Jar" have been changed to test for membership
in ["Jar", "MapReduce"]. This should support existing jobs in a
savanna database with type "Jar", even though all new jobs will be
"MapReduce"

These measures should allow this change to work with a UI which is
still using the "Jar" job type.

Closes-Bug: #1260829

Change-Id: I1ad59fa466b9a5d838c62bf366b642e453340bce

2) Tests for job_type "Jar" have been changed to test for membership
in ["Jar", "MapReduce"]. This should support existing jobs in a
savanna database with type "Jar", even though all new jobs will be
"MapReduce"

These measures should allow this change to work with a UI which is

commit_message:
Change "Jar" job type to "MapReduce"

Changes the "Jar" job type to "MapReduce".  This maps more closely
to the underlying Oozie actions, and will help remove ambiguity when
Savanna supports Oozie "java" actions in the future.

Backward compatibility is supported as follows:
1) Any job created through the conductor with job type "Jar" will
have its job type automatically changed to "MapReduce"

2) Tests for job_type "Jar" have been changed to test for membership
in ["Jar", "MapReduce"]. This should support existing jobs in a
savanna database with type "Jar", even though all new jobs will be
"MapReduce"

These measures should allow this change to work with a UI which is
still using the "Jar" job type.

Closes-Bug: #1260829

Change-Id: I1ad59fa466b9a5d838c62bf366b642e453340bce

Change-Id: I2ec8a7330e63ea64d291f2f37f0c01cdf765d4f7
'}, {'created': '2013-12-16 09:57:09.000000000', 'message': 'Fix syntax of relative imports for Python3

In Python 3, relative imports must be written "from .module import name":
http://docs.python.org/3.0/whatsnew/3.0.html#removed-syntax

Change-Id: I2ec8a7330e63ea64d291f2f37f0c01cdf765d4f7
'}]
commit_message:
Fix syntax of relative imports for Python3

In Python 3, relative imports must be written "from .module import name":
http://docs.python.org/3.0/whatsnew/3.0.html#removed-syntax

Change-Id: I2ec8a7330e63ea64d291f2f37f0c01cdf765d4f7

commit_message:
Add Sample priority

With the routing notifier we can now issue high-frequency notifications
and not worry about clogging up the queue. The Sample priority will
be used for this situation.

Change-Id: Ia4aa77b7aa4ca9458e97ca3ed81101d92934b691

commit_message:
Remove eventlet related code in amqp driver

Because driver should rely on executor and not directly on eventlet,
delete eventlet related code. This also drop the old driver API.

This is the amqp part.

Change-Id: Ic6060058dafa4dabbc5e8c68bf231c818a7fec25

[{'created': '2013-12-10 04:08:12.000000000', 'message': "Change IgnoreAttemptedHostFilter to expect 'retry' key

The newly added IgnoreAttemptedHostFilter is renamed from RetryFilter, but
there's also a change in the key it expected in filter_properties ('retry'->
'attempted').  This change actually breaks backwards compatibility if it's
been used in an environment where old/new scheduler worked together and old
scheduler processed the request prior new scheduler (old scheduler that uses
RetryFilter will add 'retry' key to filter_properties).  This kind of
situation can happen in a rolling upgrade in a multi-scheduler deployment and
should be fixed.

I only noticed it when I tested it out with Cinder in an environment which
had 3 schedulers, and I updated one of them to use IgnoreAttemptedHostFilter.

Change-Id: I0da5092833190f7e6dadfaaacfa4545e85d45a15

commit_message:
Change IgnoreAttemptedHostFilter to expect 'retry' key

The newly added IgnoreAttemptedHostFilter is renamed from RetryFilter, but
there's also a change in the key it expected in filter_properties ('retry'->
'attempted').  This change actually breaks backwards compatibility if it's
been used in an environment where old/new scheduler worked together and old
scheduler processed the request prior new scheduler (old scheduler that uses
RetryFilter will add 'retry' key to filter_properties).  This kind of
situation can happen in a rolling upgrade in a multi-scheduler deployment and
should be fixed.

Change-Id: I0da5092833190f7e6dadfaaacfa4545e85d45a15

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-17 13:24:48.000000000', 'message': "Refactored access to RequestContext.

RequestContext is passed all over the internal api and it's only used in
few places in oslo code and some ironic drivers.
I've refactored access to context to make it directly available using:
ironic.common.context.get_current_context() function
This allows us to remove context parameter from everywhere.

Review process suggestions:
1) ironic/common/context.py - This file provides basic functionality and
you need to check it to get the main idea
2) ironic/api/hooks.py - This is a entry point that publishes context
for all public API requests
3) ironic/conductor/manager.py - Entry point that publishes context for
internal tasks run by scheduler
4) Review all other files. In most files we just remove context from
parameters. In test files we fix mock assertions and setUp to publish
context manually

Change-Id: Ibe4ac3dcef430cdafca3d4785ae5fc45fd4b7751

Change-Id: Ibe4ac3dcef430cdafca3d4785ae5fc45fd4b7751

commit_message:
Refactored access to RequestContext

RequestContext is passed all over the internal api and it's only used in
few places in oslo code and some ironic drivers.
I've refactored access to context to make it directly available using:
ironic.common.context.get_current_context() function
This allows us to remove context parameter from everywhere.

Review process suggestions:
1) ironic/common/context.py - This file provides basic functionality and
you need to check it to get the main idea
2) ironic/api/hooks.py - This is a entry point that publishes context
for all public API requests
3) ironic/conductor/manager.py - Entry point that publishes context for
internal tasks run by scheduler
4) Review all other files. In most files we just remove context from
parameters. In test files we fix mock assertions and setUp to publish
context manually

Change-Id: Ibe4ac3dcef430cdafca3d4785ae5fc45fd4b7751

commit_message:
Fix a lazy-load exception in security_group_update()

When security_group_api is nova, the update_security_group api raises http
500 error: group rules fails with lazy load exception. Because the rule
infos of the security group will be return in response body, but the rule
attribute hasn't been preloaded.

Closes-Bug: #1244018
Change-Id: Ie07879ac22e4add90f75968778bf334915e8349c

commit_message:
Fix a bug in safe_encode where it returns a bytes object in py3

Used the six module to dynamically determine python version
and decode the returned bytes object to a string if python3 is
being used

Change-Id: I9e46199e86cba63f530eaef47e53f0de170bdd94
Closes-Bug: #1249995

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-13 17:22:37.000000000', 'message': 'Remove keystone from default_log_levels default

"keystone=INFO" was in the default_log_levels. This made it
more difficult than necessary to debug the Keystone server,
since you can set debug=True but then the keystone logging
level is overridden and you get no debug output for keystone.

"keystone=INFO" may have been in the default_log_levels because
of the auth_token middleware, but this has been moved to
python-keystoneclient now and the logging config for the
python APIs is done differently.

Closes-Bug: 1245629

Change-Id: Ifc4187188f2be2fc876893e9b75e062f0dfcce97
'}]
commit_message:
Remove keystone from default_log_levels default

"keystone=INFO" was in the default_log_levels. This made it
more difficult than necessary to debug the Keystone server,
since you can set debug=True but then the keystone logging
level is overridden and you get no debug output for keystone.

"keystone=INFO" may have been in the default_log_levels because
of the auth_token middleware, but this has been moved to
python-keystoneclient now and the logging config for the
python APIs is done differently.

Closes-Bug: 1245629

Change-Id: Ifc4187188f2be2fc876893e9b75e062f0dfcce97

commit_message:
Added clarity for installing Neutron plugin on dedicated controller

As reported to Launchpad, the instructions for setting up the Neutron
server on a dedicated controller that will NOT be providing any
underlying functionality are not clear as to why we need to install
and configure the plugin here.

Change-Id: Ia4ce1ea618116fa51e847e1bbb9b804ab4c32870
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: 1261158
(cherry picked from commit 9683b13fad4b892daaefd16422eb31f10ea951e3)

commit_message:
Refactor PXE DHCP Option support.

The previous support imported pxe into driver, but driver is meant to
be entirely decoupled from specific baremetal drivers.

Co-Authored-By: Robert Collins <rbtcollins@hp.com>

Change-Id: Icc7c40fe06b520aa220906122f5f6be8d79a3ac4

commit_message:
Update autogenerate-config-docs for openstack-doc-tools

Let's keep the flagmappings as part of openstack-manuals and the
tool itself in openstack-doc-tools.

This patch removes the tools and updated the documentation.
A corresponding patch for openstack-doc-tools will be done.

Change-Id: Iad8f0607af9ff8522e6d7567cfa685301813ecfe

Although intended, the Cinder Controller document does not make it
clear as to why the 'cinder-volume' service is not installed. The
guide assumes that multiple nodes are being used; one to run all

commit_message:
Added note for Cinder Controller requirements

Although intended, the Cinder Controller document does not make it
clear as to why the 'cinder-volume' service is not installed. The
guide assumes that multiple nodes are being used; one to run all
of the controller services and many other service nodes to provide
functionality. In this case, the second part of the document
provides instructions on how to complete the process. This patch
adds a node, enhancing the first paragraph to make it clearer.

Change-Id: I0c640f5e4fca438edf214bfe00480938294c3245
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: 1260338
(cherry picked from commit 46ba7f31b6f381f877c2bea3f85d9a29170dd1c7)

commit_message:
Rework repository to make it an installable python package

This is an overhaul of the complete content to make it
a separate python package that can be installed on the jenkins
machines as well as on editor's machines.

The goal of this patchset is to package everything
and get the command "openstack-doc-test" running so that
it can be used for gating.

This will need further refinement for the other commands.

Change-Id: Icc2f1807dd5ab5fb2f83c05d1b3895b3a9a0dbaf

commit_message:
Clarified location of driver config settings; removed ESX driver reference; minor text edits.

UPDATED part 3: Build failed! fixed program listing tags
UPDATED part 2: Build failed. Checked and modified tag formatting.
UPDATED: Removed tabs and applied correct use of <filename> tags.

* Clarified details of volume driver configuration settings for VMDK drivers in nova.conf and cinder.conf.

* Removed reference to ESX/ESXi server driver config because it has not been extensively tested.

* Changed occurrences of "data store" to "datastore" for consistency.

Change-Id: I2a45b131fa19749530f5fe93115518f8b9f4ea4e
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1260005
(cherry picked from commit abd25235ac3ea7c39b5899e536c7bf98321a3e1e)

commit_message:
Allow running of proxy and storage on the same node.

This adds conditionals to support a installation
in which a user desires to run both swift proxy and
storage on the same node.

Change-Id: Ic841609aea84e1c36d5285089cf344e2b497673e

commit_message:
Allow running of proxy and storage on the same node.

This adds conditionals to support a installation
in which a user desires to run both swift proxy and
storage on the same node.

Change-Id: Ia741105cd15120f13da9038165c624151f06e4f0

commit_message:
Display message on HTTP 400

This patch parses the faultstring given by the server on 400 errors if
available.

Change-Id: Ieae2f0b39fed2c45f276d6c931bebfebab9f696e
Closes-Bug: bug #1260394

commit_message:
Clarify rebuild_instance's recreate parameter.

As far as I can tell this parameter actually implies that none of the
cleanup happens - it's used when evacuating an instance to a separate
hypervisor, so the new hypervisor has rebuild(recreate=True) passed
in. The docstring didn't make that clear, so this trivial patch
hopefully does that.

blueprint: baremetal-preserve-ephemeral
Change-Id: I42463cf981fe5dbd6b3b15f7a247d5a8ccfa7279

commit_message:
add libxslt1-dev to tempest required files

tempest actually needs a pretty new lxml, which means it's
going to build it from source. To do that it needs libxslt1-dev
to compile. We should be good and let devstack do this out of
the box so it works on minimal environments.

Change-Id: Ia527905c1c15fb8c6793f0ce543ad05e25a88179
(cherry picked from commit db54311552d6c1efad7d9958a539848b3aeea775)

commit_message:
add libxslt1-dev to tempest required files

tempest actually needs a pretty new lxml, which means it's
going to build it from source. To do that it needs libxslt1-dev
to compile. We should be good and let devstack do this out of
the box so it works on minimal environments.

Change-Id: Ia527905c1c15fb8c6793f0ce543ad05e25a88179
(cherry picked from commit db54311552d6c1efad7d9958a539848b3aeea775)

commit_message:
Changes command to create the directory

Reasons:
- os.makedirs since running under normal user access
  will not be able to create the directory at
  root locations like /var/lib.

Changes:
- Used utils.execute like used at other places
  for working under root access.
- Test changed to test utils.execute instead of os.makedirs

Change-Id: Ie2313ae4cc22ac4a9baa4d8e099080f227a980c4
Closes-Bug: #1261492

commit_message:
Cleans the method init_engine

Reasons:
- init_engine contains code after return statement,
  which is of no use.
- the statements used are also of no purpose as
  they use unavailable variables.

Change:
- Code lines after return statement are removed.

Change-Id: Ibfd1f0de1d9200c0f1a724345fa9ef744da1ce7e
Closes-Bug: #1261169

commit_message:
Add Fedora 20 to IMAGE_URLS

Fedora 20 is only added to IMAGE_URLS if
$HEAT_FETCHED_TEST_IMAGE contains the exact known image name

This image is used for running heat tempest tests which require
an image which has heat-cfntools installed.

Change-Id: Ic6cdea932a5d5f3de138da96d27e407775b3e84b
