commit_message:
VMWare: bug fix for Vim exception handling

The exception handling in the Vim module was too broad and did not treat
the suds.MethodNotFound exception. This would result in a exception
that "__deepcopy__" is not supported in the VIM module.

In the case of an exception the VMwareAPISession class may be deleted.
The patch also ensures that the deletion is able to logout if necessary.

Closes-bug: #1228847

Change-Id: Ic85be9b3407c444db4b3a074108c01d9141c61be

[{'created': '2013-12-13 18:20:12.000000000', 'message': 'Add ability to configure tempest tests for advanced neutron extensions

Patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/55133/ introduced the
ability to enable/disable tests for extensions like LBaaS,
VPNaaS, or Metering via tempest config file options.

This patch introduces the Devstack variables to tune these
config options; this is useful to configure tempest runs for
third-party plugins that do not support these extensions.

Change-Id: Iee170993cb164502774f9ac4201b963d9a2715ba
Closes-bug: #1247778

commit_message:
Add ability to configure tempest tests based on network extensions

This patch introduces a Devstack variable to specify which network
extensions are enabled; this is useful for configuring tempest runs
when third-party plugins that do not support certain extensions.

Closes-bug: #1247778
Closes-bug: #1231152

Change-Id: Iee170993cb164502774f9ac4201b963d9a2715ba

subject: Convert decimal to datetime in sqlalchemy layer
messages:
[{'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2013-12-17 18:25:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

model.Event.generated is a datetime when the event is record and it must be the same when it is retrieved. Same for Datetime Trait. Otherwise we have both kind of model.Event and model.Trait in ceilometer with different type of data in.

I have rewritten the timestamp code for event to make it work on mysql (because Float won't work well for timestamp in mysql, we have recently fix the issue for sample), and ensure that every timestamp are returned as datetime by driver: 
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/62435/"}, {'account_id': 5678, 'date': '2013-12-17 18:29:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Mehdi's got a better fix for this. Thanks!"}]

[{'created': '2013-12-17 17:49:19.000000000', 'message': 'Convert decimal to datetime in sqlalchemy layer

There is a corener case in the sqlalchemy event layer where the event
timestamp is not properly converted to a datetime and is instead
returned as a float. This patch fixes that case.

Fixes bug 1261815

Change-Id: I7de839fafa8d318c482341127bb3fc0f8f71abd3
'}]
commit_message:
Convert decimal to datetime in sqlalchemy layer

There is a corener case in the sqlalchemy event layer where the event
timestamp is not properly converted to a datetime and is instead
returned as a float. This patch fixes that case.

Fixes bug 1261815

Change-Id: I7de839fafa8d318c482341127bb3fc0f8f71abd3

commit_message:
add libxslt1-dev to tempest required files

tempest actually needs a pretty new lxml, which means it's
going to build it from source. To do that it needs libxslt1-dev
to compile. We should be good and let devstack do this out of
the box so it works on minimal environments.

Change-Id: Ia527905c1c15fb8c6793f0ce543ad05e25a88179

[{'created': '2013-12-17 12:33:06.000000000', 'message': 'make delete recovery messages debug level

lvm.delete has recovery logic within it to do a second attempt
if it should fail the first time. It is currently however logging
those second attempts at error and warn levels. However, as this
is normal flow these should be debug level instead.

This is currently causing a few resets in the gate because this
is a non whitelisted error.

Change-Id: Ie684331d9d97c089ec23569d06981e90eb7f6a67
Closes-Bug: #1261731
'}]
commit_message:
make delete recovery messages debug level

lvm.delete has recovery logic within it to do a second attempt
if it should fail the first time. It is currently however logging
those second attempts at error and warn levels. However, as this
is normal flow these should be debug level instead.

This is currently causing a few resets in the gate because this
is a non whitelisted error.

Change-Id: Ie684331d9d97c089ec23569d06981e90eb7f6a67
Closes-Bug: #1261731

commit_message:
Removes dead code from trove/tests/api/root.py

Reason:
- ./trove/tests/api/root.py uses undefined method
  create_mysql_connection in log_in_as_root.
- log_in_as_root is not used anywhere in any tests.

Changes:
- Removed log_in_as_root method from ./trove/tests/api/root.py

Change-Id: Ia5ab6538cab54a98b8057d0bf4c39dda9c7e3bf8
Closes-Bug: #1261174

[{'created': '2013-12-13 16:08:29.000000000', 'message': "Move sphinxcontrib-httpdomain to test-requirements

The sphinxcontrib-httpdomain is now in the global-requirements list, so,
it'll be better to track *all* requirements in the corresponding files.

Change-Id: I6cd9eb8982cd49be1c59680a16d66acd30b9a29f
"}]
commit_message:
Move sphinxcontrib-httpdomain to test-requirements

The sphinxcontrib-httpdomain is now in the global-requirements list, so,
it'll be better to track *all* requirements in the corresponding files.

Change-Id: I6cd9eb8982cd49be1c59680a16d66acd30b9a29f

commit_message:
Add another clarifying note on nova-net install

We had another bug report about the nova-network install section.

This patch adds another very explicit,
clarifying note to ensure people are installing
packages in the right place.

Change-Id: Ifc48813af9ec1cf8a87aab96c3f95c8d474595c9
Closes-bug: 1261620

commit_message:
Sort the output of config/generator.py by group name

Sort the output of config/generator.py by group name(except the DEFAULT
group) to avoid huge changes in the output when adding new oslo.cfg
option group.

Closes-Bug: 1258363
Change-Id: I28d767e13a7b0fce4dafa1dd051779e1b1cbba86

commit_message:
Refactor time conversion helper function for objects in db api

Refactor the code to use common time conversion code for objects. Strip
timezone info out from datetimes, which is no need for database.

This is a part of: blueprint make-instance-action-use-objects

Change-Id: Id7f8b48da1499ded3418ceebe4680e066420e2a3

(1 inline comment)

I'm not super comfortable with this approach. Many of these flags have algorithmic implications, but the algorithm hasn't been broken out of libvirt's driver.

I think it would be better to break out the algorithm and then have a driver layer (or calls in the hypervisor driver layer), which implemented the hypervisor specific bits."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-12-08 08:42:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-12-08 08:47:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-12-08 08:47:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but whitespace content has changed.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-12-08 08:52:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@Michael - I have done the following:
1. extracted only the relevant common variables. The libvirt specific ones remain untocuhed
2. At the moment the algorithm is very specific to libvirt and the way in which the images are maintained in the libvirt files system. I think that we have yet to understand how we can leverage this code for other drivers.
Thanks

There's a pylint error I missed before that actually looks like a genuine problem:

2013-12-17 07:26:55.513 | nova/virt/baremetal/driver.py:500: [E1101, BareMetalDriver.manage_image_cache] Instance of 'ImageCacheManager' has no 'verify_base_images' member

You're removing the verify_base_images method but the baremetal driver is still calling it.


nova/virt/baremetal/driver.py:        self.image_cache_manager.verify_base_images(context, all_instances)

Oh and eewwwwwwwww, the bare metal driver has been importing a libvirt private class all this time :-( Is it practical for you to fix that while you're doing this refactoring, either in this patch or a later patch ?"}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-12-17 10:27:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-04 14:58:53.000000000', 'message': 'Image cache: move all of the variables to a common place

This moves image cache config from the libvirt driver into a place that
can be shared between drivers, nova.virt.imagecache

The other image cache fields that were in the nova.compute.manager
have also been moved to the common place.

DocImpact

These common configuration can be used by the
blueprint multiple-image-cache-handlers and the
blueprint vmware-image-cache-management.

Change-Id: I92080f20c3d21ec348aff7d0a9795e773bcc2649
'}, {'created': '2013-12-05 07:22:06.000000000', 'message': 'Image cache: move all of the variables to a common place

'}, {'created': '2013-12-08 08:42:00.000000000', 'message': 'Image cache: move all of the variables to a common place

This moves common image cache config from the libvirt driver into
a place that can be shared between drivers, nova.virt.imagecache
The libvirt specific image caching variables are untouched.

The other image cache fields that were in the nova.compute.manager
have also been moved to the common place.

These common configuration can be used by the
blueprint multiple-image-cache-handlers and the
blueprint vmware-image-cache-management.

DocImpact
    The following configuration variables are now in the DEFAULT
    section:
        image_cache_manager_interval
        image_cache_subdirectory_name
        remove_unused_base_images
        remove_unused_original_minimum_age_seconds

Change-Id: I92080f20c3d21ec348aff7d0a9795e773bcc2649

'}, {'created': '2013-12-08 09:45:37.000000000', 'message': 'Image cache: move all of the variables to a common place

This moves common image cache config from the libvirt driver into
a place that can be shared between drivers, nova.virt.imagecache
The libvirt specific image caching variables are untouched.

commit_message:
Image cache: move all of the variables to a common place

In addition to this it creates a base ImageCacheManager class.

This moves common image cache config from the libvirt driver into
a place that can be shared between drivers, nova.virt.imagecache
The libvirt specific image caching variables are untouched.

The other image cache fields that were in the nova.compute.manager
have also been moved to the common place.

These common configuration can be used by the
blueprint multiple-image-cache-handlers and the
blueprint vmware-image-cache-management.

DocImpact
    The following configuration variables are now in the DEFAULT
    section:
        image_cache_manager_interval
        image_cache_subdirectory_name
        remove_unused_base_images
        remove_unused_original_minimum_age_seconds

Change-Id: I92080f20c3d21ec348aff7d0a9795e773bcc2649

commit_message:
Refactor /node/<uuid>/state

* Ironic now has a periodic task that checks the current power state of
the nodes[1] and keep the db updated, so the API does not need to call
rpcapi.get_node_power_state,  it can just rely on the current status in
the DB.

* The API will now return all the states in one request, whereas before
two requests were needed (one for power, and one for provision) to get
all the state information.

* Rename /node/<uuid>/state to /node/<uuid>/states (plural) since it
returns information about both states (power and provision)

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/56530/

Change-Id: I9623a378f8743d4146a9b389d28d4f8b02aaf0e0

I have the same question as Joshua. I'd rather see this block for ever then possibly fail silently."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-09-25 11:17:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi,
If nova compute waits forever then the scheduler/api may receive an exception of an RPC timeout. This could cause inconsistencies. 
I think that a timeout is good an healthy. Maybe we need to ensure that the exception is handled so that the calling operation can make sure that the necessary cleanup is treated accordingly.
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 7069, 'date': '2013-09-26 11:36:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Yes, that was the kind of exception that I was after to be handled. Are you working on a new patchset?

'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-12-11 13:38:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

2s seems like a very short default.

Can you detail the case where ovsctl can hang forever?

If so, that sounds like a bug in ovsctl that the --timeout option is used to mask.

If we bump this timeout up to some safeguard value,
do we really need to expose it in nova config?

thanks"}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-12-11 18:24:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

@pbrady:

I agree that 2s may be a little short. At the moment there are a number of issues here:
1. the same support is being added to neutron (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/61136/)
2. in the gating it is being bumped to 10 seconds (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/61137/)

There may be cases when the DB is unreachable (the ovs db). This could cause a number of problems. Please see https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1254520 for an example of this happening.

I think that it would be good for us to enable the user to tweak this if they actually encounter problems. To be honest not really sure what the default should be - till now it was 2 seconds in neutron.

Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-12-11 18:25:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

One more thing - i think that the fact that we now have the log error we will be able to understand that this has happened and can address accordinly'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-12-12 13:10:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 6447, 'date': '2013-12-12 13:47:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-12-16 16:46:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

While I can understand the desire to not wait forever, I'm pretty concerned that this is going to cause non-deterministic failures in both the gate & production deployments. 

It feels like this change is going to swap one bug (sometimes we wait a very long time) for another bug (sometimes we won't wait long enough), and it isn't clear that the latter is a better bug to have.

We've already seen gate failures due to too-short timeouts with neutron

https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1254520

In that bug the neutron timeout was 2 seconds. This change is using 5 seconds, but how confident are we this is going to be reliable both in the gate, and in the real world where host/database loads are going to be even higher ? I'm doubful that 5 seconds is long enough."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-12-16 17:47:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

There are 2 very important changes in this patch set:
1. The ability to set the timeout for a ovs command command. In Neutron the default was 2 seconds and this was hard coded. A change has been made to Neutron to enable the administrator to configure this timeout too (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/61105/). as you had mentioned it may occur - yes, this happens in the gating (which is a VM - which may also be the source of the problem)
2. If the operation being performed and is timed out then there will at least be a LOG and an indication - please look at line 1284 (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/47788/10/nova/network/linux_net.py).

Without this, if there is a problem then you will be blocking nova compute indefinitely. A least a timeout will enable the current action to terminate and the compute node to continue doing what it does.

What do you suggest the default timeout be? If the admin does not want to set the time he/she can set it as -1 and the operation will wait indefinitely. I do not think that that is healthy. 

Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-12-16 18:15:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Given that we know 2 seconds causes problems in the gate, and the gate is not even considered "high load" by production standards, increasing it a mere 3 seconds more doesn't seem anywhere near sufficiently pessimistic. I think we should be looking at orders or magnitude longer here. ie 60, 180, 300 seconds or more.

The bug linked here doesn't really have any info on what scenario would cause ovs-vsctl to hang forever. It would really be good to know this so that a bug against ovs-vsctl itself can be filed, for a fix to stop it hanging in this way.'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-12-16 18:29:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I actually think this is a really interesting difference between the neutron and nova jobs in the gate. Neutron was timing out at 2s, nova was never timing out. The behavior in the nova side was far less racy.

So I'm with danpb here, this should really be a high timeout like 120s+. And I'd actually suggest the same thing on the neutron side."}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-12-17 00:20:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

I agree that a higher timeout is better. I think having the default timeout set to -1 (don't timeout) is even better which is what nova had set previously."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-12-17 12:41:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-17 13:17:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Works for me

It occurs to me that 120 seconds waiting for OVSDB to return is quite long. I'm curious as to what versions of OVS are used by the gate, as I suspect newer versions of OVS have improved performance across the entire OVS stack which I suspect would drastically help the gate in general. I also realize we may be tied to whatever distribution we're using and the version of OVS they ship, but it's worth noting that, for example, Ubuntu 12.04 LTS ships with an incredibly old version of OVS (1.4)."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-12-17 14:46:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

@kyle the problem this issue is trying to address is that ovs-vsctl can occasionally hang forever. This should basically never happen in normal operation, so we shouldn't hit this timeout unless something drastically bad happens. There is meanwhile a very real risk that if the timeout is too low we'll cause unnecessary failures under high load conditions. Thus the 120s timeout shouldn't cause any delays / slowness in the gate and is long enough that it shouldn't cause false failures"}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-12-17 14:49:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: (2 inline comments)

commit_message:
Add configurable 120s timeout ovs-vsctl calls

By default, or with a secs of 0, ovsâvsctl waits forever for a response
from the database. This option limits runtime to approximately 120 seconds.
If the timeout expires, ovsâvsctl will exit with a SIGALRM signal. (A
timeout would normally happen only if the database cannot be contacted,
or if the system is overloaded.)

The user can update the timeout by setting the ovs_vsctl_timeout
configuration variable.

DocImpact

Closes-bug: 1229018

Change-Id: Ica64ae98fb6162d2119021972127a82417d5ee7a

[{'created': '2013-11-23 17:59:44.000000000', 'message': 'Include image block device maps in info

In cases for example soft/hard reboot, we were just getting volume and
snapshot block device maps. For block devices with a source type image,
Nova would fall back on a local disk location and fail.

This change allows us to include block devices with a source of an
image, so that we correctly get the right the location of the block
device.

Closes-Bug: #1245719
Change-Id: I1f726293e85183d4b84c05b635a7c606a092992f

commit_message:
Include image block device maps in info

In cases for example soft/hard reboot, we were just getting volume and
snapshot block device maps. For block devices with a source type image,
Nova would fall back on a local disk location and fail.

This change allows us to include block devices with a source of an
image, so that we correctly get the right the location of the block
device.

Closes-Bug: #1245719
Change-Id: I1f726293e85183d4b84c05b635a7c606a092992f
(cherry picked from commit 85d0ace169be513c30b09e13a35fa7d912f5b380)

We don't automatically recheck or reverify, so please consider
doing that manually if someone hasn't already. For a code review
which is not yet approved, you can recheck by leaving a code
review comment with just the text:

    recheck bug 1257641

commit_message:
Reworks Node validations

This makes use of the mandatory option and complex types of WSME to
remove some of the custom validation code. The patch also includes a
new attribute on Nodes API object called chassis_uuid to store the UUID
of the chassis that Node belongs to, once this field is set it magically
converts the UUID to the numeric ID of the chassis and sets the chassis_id
attribute to be used internally.

Change-Id: Ie51761a3b9a018d101a6335ea7bafb09393816d4
Closes-Bug: #1252213
Partial-Bug: #1223847

[{'created': '2013-12-14 13:41:56.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecated the ChefRunner

We moved to use the chefspec 3.0, the `ChefSpec::ChefRunner` is
deprecated, we need use `ChefSpec::Runner` instead.

Change-Id: I203124c42cccd0c96b40518bc71006b731b2edee
'}, {'created': '2013-12-14 15:19:49.000000000', 'message': 'Upgrade to Havana release

commit_message:
Upgrade to Havana release

Also upgrade gems:
- berkshelf, ~> 2.0.10
- chefspec, ~> 3.0.2
- foodcritic, ~> 3.0.3
And update the DEPRECATION keywords

Change-Id: I203124c42cccd0c96b40518bc71006b731b2edee

commit_message:
Properly mark a backup as FAILED if the process failed

* Add a try except around the backup runner
* Moved conductor update calls outside of the scope of
  the runner with statement to catch exceptions in
  the __exit__ method.

Closes-Bug: #1256384

Change-Id: Icf539ab75314476b42a6e175c087ff61cc3608e1

commit_message:
Moving storage logic out of backup runner class

* Adding a StreamReader to handle segment logic
* Refactored base classes to make subclasses easier

Closes-Bug: #1251649

Change-Id: Ic22bb42827e0f5dc593df8705737fe27c1feabb8

I don't think this is justified for a backport to Grizzly.   The Havana backport was debatable in terms of the backport criteria, but I was good with it because H was just released and I didn't agree with making customers wait 6 months for the I release.  

That being said, now that it's in the H update, they can move to H if they care enough about the performance, and it's not critical otherwise."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-17 04:22:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Retrieve volume image metadata using single query

The image metadata REST API contributions are making an individual db
call for each of the available volumes. When the number of volumes is
large the volume details call can take several minutes.

This patch changes the image metadata API contributions to take
advantage of the new db query to retrieve metadata in bulk.

Partial-Bug: #1197612
(cherry picked from commit 56e5805203a14acad78dc806247b5f0f4a22c9f8)

Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/api/contrib/test_volume_image_metadata.py

Change-Id: I9a35438c1f38ea8a3d8f5b687ae58ba1f3f78121

commit_message:
Add call to retrieve image metadata for volumes in bulk

When using the GET volume details REST API call, the image metadata API
contribution is making an individual db call for each of the available
volumes. When the number of volumes is large the details call can take
several minutes.

This patch adds a call to the volume.API to retrieve image metadata in
bulk, very similar to the one used to retrieve individual volume image
metadata.

Partial-Bug: #1197612
(cherry picked from commit bb2daca2864a5607635a3aa37f3874fdda22797b)

Conflicts:
	cinder/db/api.py
	cinder/volume/api.py

Change-Id: Ic3aa721016704c72b7564cc5ceff71676806a24a

commit_message:
Typo in Security Guide Neutron Flow image

There was a typo in the Neutron flow image in the
security guide document. Lists one of the flows as
a "Tentant API" rather than "Tenant API". I modified
the png image and pushed as part of this commit.

http://docs.openstack.org/security-guide/content/ch033_securing-neutron-services.html

Change-Id: I1ec822972f25fd62cc9a5077975f7b556db10664
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: 1253832
(cherry picked from commit a712006543421fe866eb9e6a9d3475ca336a003f)

commit_message:
Use cached volumes in REST API extensions

This patch caches db volumes in the core volumes API so that they can be
used in the host and tenant attribute API extensions in order to lower
the response time by avoiding costly individual db queries for each
volume in the REST API contributions.

Partial-Bug: #1197612
(cherry picked from commit 9ed0f39fceaaa7a56e74055b54b7f6124e9e7f11)

Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/api/v1/test_volumes.py

Change-Id: Ie0cbe929379df32fddbdce1953f13b6f26208bff

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-09 04:25:54.000000000', 'message': 'Remove commands not supported by Nova V3 API

Remove commands which are no longer supported by the Nova
V3 API and that we will definitely not be proxying to another
service. Removes:

- cloudpipe-list
- cloudpipe-create
- cloudpipe-configure
- coverage-start
- coverage-stop
- coverage-report
- coverage-reset

Partially implements blueprint v3-api

Change-Id: I366cd0233977c1b506d55de280188ecccda8188f

commit_message:
Remove commands not supported by Nova V3 API

Remove commands which are no longer supported by the Nova
V3 API and that we will definitely not be proxying to another
service. Removes:

- cloudpipe-list
- cloudpipe-create
- cloudpipe-configure
- coverage-start
- coverage-stop
- coverage-report
- coverage-reset

Partially implements blueprint v3-api

Change-Id: I366cd0233977c1b506d55de280188ecccda8188f

have was using it.

keyring.backend.* was deprecated in python-keyring 1.1 and we already

which removes the deprecated paths.

Co-Authored-By: Sebastian Ramacher <sramacher@debian.org>

commit_message:
Stop using deprecated keyring backends

keyring.backend.* was deprecated in python-keyring 1.1 and we already
require keyring 1.6.1. This also makes novaclient compatible with python-keyring 3.0
which removes the deprecated paths.

http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=728470#10.

Change-Id: I4919ac515e589fddc6044c0cd2f4cbc06c2ec91f
Co-Authored-By: Sebastian Ramacher <sramacher@debian.org>

add some tests for aggregates

Mainly add some negative tests for Aggregates API, and seperate negative
testcases into a dedicated file according to
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/tempest/HACKING.html#negative-tests.

Fix Issues in Marconi integration

This patch fixes a couple of issues, that prevents marconi from running
on devstack.

Change-Id: I47060a0334ad6f90f1402b34c83bb6ad22f723d4
Closes-Bug: #1260820

I like that the image upload recipe is being separated. Perhaps, we should also create a separate role, i.e., os-image-upload ?'}, {'account_id': 1475, 'date': '2013-12-03 14:43:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 7128, 'date': '2013-12-03 15:19:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

What about a redhat-spec for this?'}, {'account_id': 7128, 'date': '2013-12-03 16:40:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Another question.  After looking at the packages installed in the attributes/default.rb, the python-glanceclient is only explicitly installed in the SUSE case.  So, technically the glance command line would fail on the other platforms (RedHat and Ubuntu).   But I suspect that some of the base server packages call out the client package as a dependency and therefore it gets installed.

I would think we should NOT rely on base package dependencies since they vary quite a bit across the platforms.   This new recipe should make sure the glance client is installed, and maybe for completeness, that should go into a separate CLI recipe?'}, {'account_id': 7220, 'date': '2013-12-03 19:12:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I'd go so far as to just yank the whole image-upload section entirely. I get it's nice in theory, but in practice I've had problems with it."}, {'account_id': 6526, 'date': '2013-12-04 02:38:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

If there is no special test cases for redhat, then I think we need not the separate spec for it."}, {'account_id': 9488, 'date': '2013-12-04 03:10:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I think remove the attribute default["openstack"]["image"]["image_upload"] and add a new separate image upload role is better.'}, {'account_id': 9223, 'date': '2013-12-04 06:53:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9223, 'date': '2013-12-04 06:58:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-04 07:02:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 9223, 'date': '2013-12-04 07:08:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Re Mark Vanderwiel, since there's no specific for redhat, I think there's no need adding a redhat_spec case for image_upload recipe. For the 2nd comment, I agree to install the glanceclient package in the image upload recipe but it does not need to go into a separate CLI recipe. I added a new image_client_packages attribute to specify the required glance client packages."}, {'account_id': 9223, 'date': '2013-12-04 07:08:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

re zhiwei's comment, addressed."}, {'account_id': 6526, 'date': '2013-12-04 10:12:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 9223, 'date': '2013-12-04 10:40:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 9223, 'date': '2013-12-04 10:41:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 6526, 'date': '2013-12-04 10:43:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-04 10:45:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- gate-cookbook-openstack-image-chef-lint http://logs.openstack.org/17/59717/3/check/gate-cookbook-openstack-image-chef-lint/22907ca : SUCCESS in 4m 41s
- gate-cookbook-openstack-image-chef-unit http://logs.openstack.org/17/59717/3/check/gate-cookbook-openstack-image-chef-unit/c76bef6 : SUCCESS in 4m 51s
'}, {'account_id': 7128, 'date': '2013-12-04 15:33:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Eric, while the change to install the python-glanceclient within the recipe will force the dependency to be solved, I don't think this is the right approach.
The caller of the resource (image) should NOT have to understand the implementation dependencies of the resource provider.

I believe the correct fix for this is to have a way for the provider to specify it's own dependencies for any thing it needs to implement the resource actions.

I don't think the current architecture allows for such a dependency, but the next closest thing from what I see is to have the cookbooks default recipe install any dependencies that are needed by the providers."}, {'account_id': 2589, 'date': '2013-12-04 19:46:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

While a general mechanism is useful, in this particular case, it is sufficient to have python-glanceclient included as part of image recipes. Typically, one will upload image on a machine where python-glancelclient is known to have been installed. I think that a separate patch should be submitted  where resource dependencies are included within providers.'}, {'account_id': 2589, 'date': '2013-12-04 19:50:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 9223, 'date': '2013-12-05 10:58:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Mark, like Salman suggested, I also thought that it is enough to include python-glanceclient package as a part of image_upload recipe for this case. As to the general mechanism, we can handle it in another new patch commit.'}, {'account_id': 7128, 'date': '2013-12-05 15:58:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Salman, Eric, thanks for your responses. I have started a discussion in the ML to try to understand best way to handle provider implementations that require platform packages.  Since this is an issue in almost all the cookbook, I agree that a new set of patches specific to that is the right way to attack it.'}, {'account_id': 1032, 'date': '2013-12-05 16:56:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Move image upload part from api recipe to new recipe of image_upload.

Since for bug 1257169 openstack-image api recipe should be executed before
openstack-image registry recipe, the image upload part in the api recipe need
to be moved to a new recipe of image_upload.

Change-Id: I1f557d2e817643a9e3e06788dc446c970ef2df89
Closes-Bug: #1257169

commit_message:
Import install_venv from oslo

The new version of install_venv_common evaluates requirements.txt
and test-requirements.txt at the same time and we avoid Django 1.6
is installed when evaluating django-nose dependencies.

Change-Id: I2ab7108b3615ac6c0525089b81b80e5c0a4793fc
Closes-Bug: #1250581
(cherry picked from commit 7a0581bb701dbb4d7d9fb1bbe1d7644e98ac2b2e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-14 14:23:04.000000000', 'message': 'Typo in Security Guide Neutron Flow image

There was a typo in the Neutron flow image in the
security guide document. Lists one of the flows as
a "Tentant API" rather than "Tenant API". I modified
the png image and pushed as part of this commit.

http://docs.openstack.org/security-guide/content/ch033_securing-neutron-services.html

Change-Id: I1ec822972f25fd62cc9a5077975f7b556db10664
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: 1253832
'}]
commit_message:
Typo in Security Guide Neutron Flow image

There was a typo in the Neutron flow image in the
security guide document. Lists one of the flows as
a "Tentant API" rather than "Tenant API". I modified
the png image and pushed as part of this commit.

http://docs.openstack.org/security-guide/content/ch033_securing-neutron-services.html

Change-Id: I1ec822972f25fd62cc9a5077975f7b556db10664
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: 1253832

commit_message:
Remove unused code/fix misplaced private

The external_ids functions should not be private. The set_resilency code
is completely unused.

Change-Id: I3d7d08c4e84f48532138f406e082057991388968

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-11 09:40:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fix KeyError while generating a WSGI response

The KeyError exception raised while generating a WSGI response based on
the 413 exception. Because there may be no "Retry-After" attribute in the
exception headers.

Change-Id: I89eb1878acc2195775be17fbcba8088f2e00bac1
Closes-Bug: #1259867
'}]
commit_message:
Fix KeyError while generating a WSGI response

The KeyError exception raised while generating a WSGI response based on
the 413 exception. Because there may be no "Retry-After" attribute in the
exception headers.

Change-Id: I89eb1878acc2195775be17fbcba8088f2e00bac1
Closes-Bug: #1259867

commit_message:
Fix VMware settings

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/61520 had a pasto in it.
The change was "Clarified details of volume driver configuration
settings for VMDK drivers in nova.conf and cinder.conf."
But the change itself was in both cases the same line for cinder.conf.
Fix the nova.conf setting.

Change-Id: I4a5f201d3724aa25c0a752696860cd718124443b
backport: havana

commit_message:
Generalize base test case to common code

To reduce code duplication, base test case generalized to common.test.
Thus it can be reused in other projects.

Change-Id: I75d14b17b19636af1564e4d11d889db1589a9742

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-17 02:27:41.000000000', 'message': 'Permit setting overcloud image update policies.

This is the first step towards preserving state on stack updates when the image
id has changed.

I chose REPLACE as the default value because that is the current behaviour and
we can override it from the command line.

Change-Id: I64eab51892922ab51a89a9f389457fd1ed979fb2
'}]
commit_message:
Permit setting overcloud image update policies.

This is the first step towards preserving state on stack updates when the image
id has changed.

I chose REPLACE as the default value because that is the current behaviour and
we can override it from the command line.

Change-Id: I64eab51892922ab51a89a9f389457fd1ed979fb2

commit_message:
XenAPI: Speedup host_ref cannot change - get it once

The host we run on is fixed - getting this each time from XAPI
is expensive

Change-Id: Ifee9a778f3ed855ef52b001de3fc2ebbd0b972cf

[{'created': '2013-12-16 16:02:00.000000000', 'message': "Added note for Cinder Controller requirements

Although intended, the Cinder Controller document does not make it
clear as to why the 'cinder-volume' service is not installed. The
guide assumes that multiple nodes are being used; one to run all
of the controller services and many other service nodes to provide
functionality. In this case, the second part of the document
provides instructions on how to complete the process. This patch
adds a node, enhancing the first paragraph to make it clearer.

Change-Id: I0c640f5e4fca438edf214bfe00480938294c3245
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: 1260338
"}, {'created': '2013-12-16 23:11:36.000000000', 'message': "Added note for Cinder Controller requirements

clear as to why the 'cinder-volume' service is not installed. The
guide assumes that multiple nodes are being used; one to run all
of the controller services and many other service nodes to provide
functionality. In this case, the second part of the document
provides instructions on how to complete the process. This patch

Change-Id: I0c640f5e4fca438edf214bfe00480938294c3245
backport: havana

commit_message:
Added note for Cinder Controller requirements

Although intended, the Cinder Controller document does not make it
clear as to why the 'cinder-volume' service is not installed. The
guide assumes that multiple nodes are being used; one to run all
of the controller services and many other service nodes to provide
functionality. In this case, the second part of the document
provides instructions on how to complete the process. This patch
adds a node, enhancing the first paragraph to make it clearer.

Change-Id: I0c640f5e4fca438edf214bfe00480938294c3245
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: 1260338

python3 already is on utf8 so unless we specify a new encoding to encode
to we don't want to encode.

Change-Id: Id871898681ba68244b9ca4f115dfecbc4d363132
Closes-Bug: 1261703
"}]
commit_message:
On python3 don't try encoding string.

python3 already is on utf8 so unless we specify a new encoding to encode
to we don't want to encode.

Change-Id: Id871898681ba68244b9ca4f115dfecbc4d363132
Closes-Bug: 1261703

commit_message:
Added Neutron configuration for Nova in dedicated compute install

The installation instructions for provisioning a dedicated compute
node alongside OpenStack Networking was incomplete. It did not cover
how to configure Nova itself to communicate and make use of Neutron
networking.

Change-Id: I6e4772f5460ff84109db21c28e4edd2ff7e45d7f
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: 1260566
(cherry picked from commit e445d6d283b728ed2853660e4cdcd9108b32bd39)

commit_message:
Added clarity for installing Neutron plugin on dedicated controller

As reported to Launchpad, the instructions for setting up the Neutron
server on a dedicated controller that will NOT be providing any
underlying functionality are not clear as to why we need to install
and configure the plugin here.

Change-Id: Ia4ce1ea618116fa51e847e1bbb9b804ab4c32870
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: 1261158

Make passwords consistent

commit_message:
Update openstack-common.conf modules

Add gettextutils and importutils to the list of modules to copy
from oslo-incubator.

Change-Id: Idd36266902d9c2f6002a189786fcfb6dc5615869

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-16 14:42:52.000000000', 'message': 'Fix and enable gating on H306

H306, module imports should be in alphabetical order
This hacking check actually improves readability quite
a bit, as module imports can be sorted in groups (python stdlibs,
external imports, in-module imports)

Change-Id: I11dc9155fbfc84389f2a5956f393f705388f83ba
'}]
commit_message:
Fix and enable gating on H306

H306, module imports should be in alphabetical order
This hacking check actually improves readability quite
a bit, as module imports can be sorted in groups (python stdlibs,
external imports, in-module imports)

Change-Id: I11dc9155fbfc84389f2a5956f393f705388f83ba

commit_message:
Use private ID range in networks verify

VLAN ID range from Neutron L2 is used for private network during networks verification.
Tests added.

Closes-Bug: #1254532

Change-Id: I2fb5288786e2110c08c7e3fcdad0e100281b96b6

commit_message:
Python3: replace UserString by six.moves.UserString

This makes this code compatible with both Python 2 and 3.

Change-Id: Ie209e716defc45436ea29aa7117de018ff273e72

[{'created': '2013-12-16 22:27:08.000000000', 'message': "Fix use-ephemeral rsync of directory

If the stateful path source is a directory we need to copy the directory
completely to the target, otherwise a new version of the directory will
be copied as a sub-directory in the target.

We also fix bugs with doubling /'s which may cause problems with the
script later on.

Change-Id: I51736171db6059e30f147c5027866a538305f0f5
"}, {'created': '2013-12-16 22:31:45.000000000', 'message': "Fix use-ephemeral rsync of directory

If the stateful path source is a directory we need to copy the directory
completely to the target, otherwise source directory will be copied as a
sub-directory of the target. For example /var/lib/cinder will be copied
to /mnt/state/var/lib/cinder/cinder.

We also fix bugs with doubling /'s which may cause problems with the
script later on.

Change-Id: I51736171db6059e30f147c5027866a538305f0f5
"}]
commit_message:
Fix use-ephemeral rsync of directory

If the stateful path source is a directory we need to copy the directory
completely to the target, otherwise source directory will be copied as a
sub-directory of the target. For example /var/lib/cinder will be copied
to /mnt/state/var/lib/cinder/cinder.

We also fix bugs with doubling /'s which may cause problems with the
script later on.

Change-Id: I51736171db6059e30f147c5027866a538305f0f5

commit_message:
Merge Fake OpenStack Clients from two UTs

After moving the 'Fake' test objects to a special module, it is now
possible to get rid of the Fake OpenStack clients used previously in the
tests.test_osclients module.

Blueprint unit-tests-refactoring

Change-Id: I80e695d2498d074602cfa22982ea55f3e5a53c37

commit_message:
Configure libvirt migration on the RedHat and Debian-Ubuntu

It introduces Red Hat support and fix Ubuntu / Debian libvirt
configuration to support live migrations when using libvirt nova driver.

Change-Id: I72f03316e79ce3b83959def79b86056c934ce62d
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>
(cherry picked from commit daac3744caef40a4770d467391d270dd28514809)

commit_message:
Enabled binary mode while writing to a file

This won't affect operation on *NIX systems. However, using
just 'w' will not write files with proper line endings on
windows

Change-Id: Ife02e7fe0bf5d460aab595e238988de05e2b5f29
Closes-Bug: #1261585

[{'created': '2013-12-17 01:32:17.000000000', 'message': "Keystone: make logging configurable...

Adds top level keystone.debug and keystone.verbose config parameters
to control Keystone logging.

The motivation for this change is so that we can more easily
control the log level of Keystone. For production our default log
level is still WARN, and for CI we'll be able to easily increase
the level to DEBUG.

Change-Id: Id164b484c425f1a20c12aebbea5316702190e2f4
"}]
commit_message:
Keystone: make logging configurable...

Adds top level keystone.debug and keystone.verbose config parameters
to control Keystone logging.

The motivation for this change is so that we can more easily
control the log level of Keystone. For production our default log
level is still WARN, and for CI we'll be able to easily increase
the level to DEBUG.

Change-Id: Id164b484c425f1a20c12aebbea5316702190e2f4

commit_message:
Create lock directory for cinder

This patch creates the /var/lock/cinder directory (or other location
specified in the corresponding attribute) to use for lock files.

Change-Id: I23d2d8a201f892cc1bf56f8db825f70fc1fdf5d6

Separate negative tests for test_networks

Add negative tests for test_networks to a specific file.

Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>
blueprint negative-test-files

Change-Id: I378d3edd64ee611f7567df281abc07fb4170f206

commit_message:
Configure libvirt migration on the RedHat and Debian-Ubuntu

It introduces Red Hat support and fix Ubuntu / Debian libvirt
configuration to support live migrations when using libvirt nova driver.

Change-Id: I72f03316e79ce3b83959def79b86056c934ce62d
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-04 22:34:51.000000000', 'message': 'Limit coverage report to horizon modules

Reduce scope of coverage to horizon/* and openstack_dashboard/*
to get a more accurate % of coverage.
As a bonus, generated report folder size gets reduced ( >50%).

Change-Id: Id375e88ae478277b2af9191937c1b91f4b616250
'}]
commit_message:
Limit coverage report to horizon modules

Reduce scope of coverage to horizon/* and openstack_dashboard/*
to get a more accurate % of coverage.
As a bonus, generated report folder size gets reduced ( >50%).

Change-Id: Id375e88ae478277b2af9191937c1b91f4b616250

[{'created': '2013-11-17 01:37:30.000000000', 'message': 'Compact pre-Icehouse database migrations <= 170.

Compacts the pre-Icehouse database migrations <= 170 into a
single migration (170_havana.py).

Pre-Icehouse users will now need to upgrade to Havana before
running any Icehouse migrations.

Tested on MySQL and PostgreSQL schemas on Fedora 19 to ensure the
new compacted migration generates an identical schema to the
previous migrate scripts in Havana.

Specific changes include:

1) removed 161_fix_system_metadata_none_strings.py. Nothing to
do here since this was a data conversion (no schema changes)

2) Removed some placeholder migrations for the Grizzly stable
branch.

commit_message:
Compact pre-Icehouse database migrations <= 170.

Compacts the pre-Icehouse database migrations <= 170 into a
single migration (170_havana.py).

Pre-Icehouse users will now need to upgrade to Havana before
running any Icehouse migrations.

Tested on MySQL and PostgreSQL schemas on Fedora 19 to ensure the
new compacted migration generates an identical schema to the
previous migrate scripts in Havana.

Specific changes include:

1) removed 161_fix_system_metadata_none_strings.py. Nothing to
do here since this was a data conversion (no schema changes)

2) Removed some placeholder migrations for the Grizzly stable
branch.

Change-Id: I94a080ca122af009304975044f33c5e5192834ab
Implements: blueprint compact-havana-db-migrations

commit_message:
Delete expectation of passed tests in ostf run

Chang methods:
* assert_ostf_run
* run_ostf
* invocation of mathod assert_run_ostf in tests

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-13 21:44:40.000000000', 'message': 'Add breadcrumb to containers panel

When user has drilled down into pseudo-folders, display a hyperlinked
breadcrumb list to show user where they currently are. User can also
navigate up the hierarchy using the breadcrumbs.

Screenshot is available from
https://region-b.geo-1.objects.hpcloudsvc.com/v1/40876871865944/cont/breadcrumb.png

Closes-Bug: #1260864
Change-Id: I0af081badbc23751999a985d9e02421a84af1059
'}]
commit_message:
Add breadcrumb to containers panel

When user has drilled down into pseudo-folders, display a hyperlinked
breadcrumb list to show user where they currently are. User can also
navigate up the hierarchy using the breadcrumbs.

Screenshot is available from
https://region-b.geo-1.objects.hpcloudsvc.com/v1/40876871865944/cont/breadcrumb.png

Closes-Bug: #1260864
Change-Id: I0af081badbc23751999a985d9e02421a84af1059

I agree to add configurations in local_settings.py.
I think it can be done later. If so, it should be filed as a bug. If there is no action and we approve this patch, the discussion will be lost :-('}, {'account_id': 8302, 'date': '2013-11-27 02:45:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Thanks for everyone's comments. I think there are 2 parts at play here, each with their own value-add:

1. Ensuring that users are able to see all image custom properties. Currently, the image detail is misleading because only properties that appear on the whitelist are shown to users.

2. Ensuring that custom properties have the ability to have titles and associated translations (some may not have any at all but we should still not hide them). Operators should also have the ability to provide translations for properties that don't fall in the "default" set of custom properties.

This patch currently addresses #1. To fully execute #2, I really think it's best to create a separate bug+patch (I'm happy to do both) as they are 2 different concerns. 

Matthias, the whitelist will always be necessary. Including when we move to local_settings.py, this is technically another form of whitelisting. Please let me know your thoughts and I will continue as needed.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-12-04 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Abandoned

commit_message:
Show all custom properties on image detail page

Display all custom properties of a given image on the Image Detail
page. Titles for the custom properties can optionally be displayed
if they are defined in IMAGE_CUSTOM_PROPERTY_TITLES in local
settings.

Change-Id: I7366ec06bf7d77810d7d8fd343390bc1a5eb0674
Closes-Bug: #1249543

Looks like call_command is only called from here:

https://github.com/openstack/os-collect-config/blob/69d74dde12858de0af3d480c4e0fd5a5fcc825b9/os_collect_config/collect.py#L206

So fixing it to call `command` rather than `CONF.command` shouldn't have any unforeseen consequences."}, {'account_id': 1926, 'date': '2013-12-16 13:03:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

lgtm, Note that the change in the log message won't be seen in tripleo, as far as I can see WARN is the default debug level."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-12-16 14:48:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Derek - I was using os-collect-config --debug to debug something'}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-12-16 19:37:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This appears to include two distinct things: log the environment variables, and fix a bug where we bypassed the API for the function.

The former is fairly cosmetic, but I'd like a test for the latter - and it really should be in the commit summary. Perhaps you want to split this into two patches (one thing per patch) though given how shallow it is I would understand you calling that overkill.

Anyhow - a test for the bugfix please."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-12-17 07:59:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-17 08:02:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-16 11:25:41.000000000', 'message': "Log the value of OS_CONFIG_FILES

We pass the list of json files containing the collected metadata to
os-refresh-config using the OS_CONFIG_FILES env variable, so it's a
pretty useful piece of information to log.

Also, actually use the command parameter passed to call_command() rather
than the global value we always pass to it.

Change-Id: Id09e3f352e6a5a09e4183c0743a6e99a2783a888
"}, {'created': '2013-12-17 07:59:29.000000000', 'message': "Log the value of OS_CONFIG_FILES

We pass the list of json files containing the collected metadata to
os-refresh-config using the OS_CONFIG_FILES env variable, so it's a
pretty useful piece of information to log.

Change-Id: Id09e3f352e6a5a09e4183c0743a6e99a2783a888
"}]
commit_message:
Log the value of OS_CONFIG_FILES

We pass the list of json files containing the collected metadata to
os-refresh-config using the OS_CONFIG_FILES env variable, so it's a
pretty useful piece of information to log.

Change-Id: Id09e3f352e6a5a09e4183c0743a6e99a2783a888

[{'created': '2013-12-16 09:15:12.000000000', 'message': 'Allow user to specify image to use during rescue

Adds an extension for specifying the image to be used during
rescue of an instance. If the image is not specified, then the
base image ref is used by default.

This commit adds the extension for v3.

Partially implements: blueprint allow-image-to-be-specified-during-rescue

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ib1d31b171e8f83b633125c0c48678f8f4be1b484

commit_message:
Allow user to specify image to use during rescue

Adds an extension for specifying the image to be used during
rescue of an instance. If the image is not specified, then the
base image ref is used by default.

This commit adds the extension for v3.

Partially implements: blueprint allow-image-to-be-specified-during-rescue

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ib1d31b171e8f83b633125c0c48678f8f4be1b484

commit_message:
fix usage of need_default in parse_storage_policies

The need_default varible in parse_storage_policies seems to mark the
case that there no policy is set to default. If True, the function trys
to use first policy as default. If False, that means there is a policy
is set yes for default option, not false values. So set need_default
False only if a policy says he is the default one.

Change-Id: Idc293366e6c529423e75900783570ffb6925533b

commit_message:
Fix unable to add allow all IPv4/6 security group rule

Previously, if one tried to add a rule to allow all ingress ipv4 neutron
would respond that the rule was already part of the security group.
This happened as the filter for querying existing rules uses a wildcard for
remote_group_id thus returning a false match. This patch addresses
this issue.

Change-Id: I0320013a3869d25fb424995354721929465d2848
Closes-bug: #1252806
(cherry picked from commit 9335ffd7c3eaad0d66d7d19e7760ae12476a5ea2)

subject: Default to /24 prefix for floating IP range with neutron

I think /27 will be enough as it will give 32 IP addresses.
A further shortage might happen if we then increase parallelism.

I chose /27 for laziness. This way I did not have to change the gateway IP as well.
If there are no arguments against using a /24 for neutron public network I am happy to use a /24'}, {'account_id': 8122, 'date': '2013-11-27 13:15:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Default to /24 prefix for floating IP range with neutron

When running Tempest parallel tests with neutron, several long-running
tests might create routers and floating IPs, which will result in
IP allocations over the public network.

Increasing the public network size should ensure tests do not fail
due to IP address shortage; this patch also updates the public network
gateway IP address.

Related-Bug: 1253966

Change-Id: Ie075b3c4d14a07b06c42fd29b09770dd1972aa45

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-16 22:55:41.000000000', 'message': "Remove unused code from volume manager (reset_stats)

self._last_volume_stats appears to be unused, now that we don't
use _volume_stats_changed().  This means reset_stats() also does
nothing.

This triggered a pylint 'attribute-defined-outside-init' warning.

Change-Id: I4c4f7497e72f726f3430f90df61188bf2f1073c1
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unused code from volume manager (reset_stats)

self._last_volume_stats appears to be unused, now that we don't
use _volume_stats_changed().  This means reset_stats() also does
nothing.

This triggered a pylint 'attribute-defined-outside-init' warning.

Change-Id: I4c4f7497e72f726f3430f90df61188bf2f1073c1

[{'created': '2013-12-11 23:17:03.000000000', 'message': 'Oslo sync to recover from db2 server disconnects

A checkout listener can be added to sqlalchemy to be able to
handle database disconnect pessimistically and avoid an error in
the event of a DB restart or simply a temp connection issue due
to network glitches. At the moment only mysql is enabled with
this feature. This patch enables db2 as well.

Oslo version in change I5563360b43c4b648f5b035099b0e1d2e71d32503

Partial-Bug: #1231657
Change-Id: Idf8b3b11a06790813fed218bdbaf130554f80fa3
'}]
commit_message:
Oslo sync to recover from db2 server disconnects

A checkout listener can be added to sqlalchemy to be able to
handle database disconnect pessimistically and avoid an error in
the event of a DB restart or simply a temp connection issue due
to network glitches. At the moment only mysql is enabled with
this feature. This patch enables db2 as well.

Oslo version in change I5563360b43c4b648f5b035099b0e1d2e71d32503

Partial-Bug: #1231657
Change-Id: Idf8b3b11a06790813fed218bdbaf130554f80fa3

commit_message:
Implement the /v2/sample API

This is a simple implementation of the new sample endpoint in the API.
It provides raw accesses to the samples collected by Ceilometer, without
imposing any kind of filtering on the meter name.

The fields are also correctly named this time.

Change-Id: I9e01a082c04e0462811befd98899e2f2d4a4dc82
Blueprint: sample-api

commit_message:

[{'account_id': 8674, 'date': '2013-10-01 13:25:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

IMPORTANT NOTE:

django_openstack_auth was falling back on keystone 2.0 while horizon was falling back on version3. Since we now use django_openstack_auth's fallback, please log me a https://bugs.launchpad.net/django-openstack-auth ticket if you want the default fallback to be version 3 in django-openstack-auth, and mark this current bug as depending on the new ticket.

It's very important, because for users who did not configure settings.OPENSTACK_API_VERSIONS["identity"], they could have a surprise after an upgrade.
Otherwise, we should add a release note mentioning this default fallback version.

Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-10-01 14:12:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

commit_message:
Common keystone version fallback

If OPENSTACK_API_VERSIONS["identity"] was not set in local_settings.py,
django_openstack_auth and horizon had their own fallback method which
did not necessarily fallback on the same version and was leading to
discrepancies and erratic behavior.

Refactored in order to use the same fallback method defined in
django_openstack_auth.utils

Change-Id: I583d49a73077a20baf5f01628b0b6e8480296964
Closes-Bug: #1231357

commit_message:
Adds flavor access support for Nova V3 API

Adds the remaining flavors support for the Nova V3 API.

Partially implements blueprint v3-api

Change-Id: I46cdec8999f74af37a9ca4280d123907124bad39

subject: Adds flavor support for Nova V3 API

The first part of adding flavor support for the Nova V3 API (support
for flavor-access API calls is still to come).

reused for the V3 version of the tests. If it looks too ugly an

cost of duplicated code. The upside though is it would be much
easier to remove v1_1/v2 support in the future.

Partially implements blueprint v3-api

commit_message:
Adds flavor support for Nova V3 API

The first part of adding flavor support for the Nova V3 API (support
for flavor-access API calls is still to come).

Restructures v1_1 testcases so as much as possible so they can be
reused for the V3 version of the tests. If it looks too ugly an
alternative would be to just cut and paste the fakes and test
from v1_1 to v3, which is simpler to understand but comes at the
cost of duplicated code. The upside though is it would be much
easier to remove v1_1/v2 support in the future.

Partially implements blueprint v3-api

Change-Id: Ic7cb3c43db02c07d37aea2675b310aaa50639c40

commit_message:
WaitCondition Count property is now updatable

The Count property of WaitCondition resource was modified to be
updatable.
Now, when that property is updated, the WaitCondition and the associated
WaitConditionHandle are no longer being regenerated.

Change-Id: If234b7a1400ff1b2c17fc24c436d8f64f4b1fd88
Closes-Bug: #1228362

'}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-11-13 18:51:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

It is not so clear for me what is happening here for me. 

I mean we have instance of one shared class. That lazy load API on first call (1 time). 
# I am not sure that it is so in real life, but in comments seems like so. 


Now we have the code that makes new instance of API on each call. (not equivalent change).. 

Or I miss something?"}, {'account_id': 7491, 'date': '2013-11-14 09:35:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7491, 'date': '2013-11-14 09:36:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (3 inline comments)

Hello Boris. Thanks for review.

At the moment we are creating the DBAPI instance once, in project's db.api module (see, for example, look at Nova - https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/db/api.py#L58)
Then we are geting (loading, in fact) backend when we make first DB-API call and then use it.

This patch change it - we will load backend, when we are creating the DBAPI instance. This instance global for project's db.api module, so we are still loads new backend only once, not on each db-api call."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-11-14 09:38:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGit#Test_Failures

(1 inline comment)

I'd like to propose a different commit message :)

Otherwise, looks great. I really like the way you simplified this code and completely agree that lazy loading of a DB backend is not needed here at all, as it gives us no benefits, but requires to use redundant locks and checks."}, {'account_id': 7491, 'date': '2013-11-14 13:03:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-11-14 13:03:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 7491, 'date': '2013-11-14 13:03:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 6849, 'date': '2013-11-14 13:05:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-11-14 13:06:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- gate-oslo-incubator-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/85/55985/4/check/gate-oslo-incubator-pep8/631c61c : SUCCESS in 1m 31s
- gate-oslo-incubator-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/85/55985/4/check/gate-oslo-incubator-docs/8991151/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 51s
- gate-oslo-incubator-python26 http://logs.openstack.org/85/55985/4/check/gate-oslo-incubator-python26/53cf152 : SUCCESS in 3m 11s
- gate-oslo-incubator-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/85/55985/4/check/gate-oslo-incubator-python27/e05edea : SUCCESS in 2m 43s
'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-11-19 14:04:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-11-19 17:43:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Thank you for better commit message. Now it is clear what this change makes.'}, {'account_id': 6722, 'date': '2013-11-20 12:23:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Victor,
Thanks for the cleanup.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-11-21 00:19:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Is the global being created in the projects? I don't see it here in this file.

Before the db package can leave the incubator, we need to fix the fact that eventlet is baked into this class. If we do that, how much of DBAPI is actually left?"}, {'account_id': 6849, 'date': '2013-11-21 14:27:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@Doug

Yes, the global variable is created in a target project (e.g. in Nova https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/db/api.py#L58).

So DBAPI class is used for different purposes:

1) to make it possible to have a few implementations of DBAPI (e.g. one for RDMBS by the means of SQLAlchemy, one for MySQL using plain MySQL DB-API driver, etc) switchable via config option

2) to wrap DB API calls to be executed by tpool threads. This is only needed when eventlet is used together with DB-API driver implemented as a Python C extension (eventlet can't monkey patch C code, so we end up with DB API calls blocking all green threads when using Python-MySQLdb). eventlet has a workaround known as 'tpool' which is basically a pool of real OS threads that can play nicely with eventlet event loop. tpool feature is experimental and known to have stability problems. I personally, doubt anyone uses it in production at all. Nova API (and probably other API services) has an option to prefork the process on start, so that they don't need to use tpool when using eventlet.

I'd really like us to drop tpool support from oslo.db. As a library we should not be bound to any particular concurrency model. If a target project is using eventlet, I believe, it is its problem how to make it play nicely with Python-MySQLdb lib, but not the problem of oslo.db. We might want to separate tpool wrapper into another helper module within oslo-incubator though. But I'd really like us not to have this in oslo.db.

(not merged yet)

commit_message:
Remove lazy loading of database backend

A single DBAPI instance is created globally in target projects at module
import time. As those projects are mostly API services (i.e. DB
oriented), there is no much sense in lazy loading of a DB backend. On
the other hand, if we initialize the DB backend as soon as a DBAPI
instance is created, we simplify code a lot, get rid of the lock and
remove the overhead of checking if the backend has been initialized from
every __getattr__() call.

Change-Id: I9fdf3eab32ee0f078d64fbde35df81c2d1123ae2

commit_message:
Need tgt for cinder

Cinder uses tgt to expose volumes via iscsi. Without tgt cinder will
fail to schedule/setup all volumes. Cinder does not actually utilize
iscsitarget, which is a competing iscsi management solution to tgt.

Closes-Bug: #1261504
Change-Id: I29595b206c4e85d68fbfa82db3d32a0b8b9dd89e

The V2 API doesn't not allow empty `container_format` and `disk_format`

commit_message:
V2: disallow image format update for active status

The V2 API doesn't not allow empty `container_format` and `disk_format`
when creating a new image.
Currently, it is possible to update these properties after data have
been saved to the image which is contradictory with the previous
statement.
This change disallows modifications of these properties for images with
a status different than `queued`.

Change-Id: I98c22197ba6d96470976718d48ac53748a19ffc6
Closes-Bug: #1249412

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-06 00:36:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix display of images in Rebuild Instance

The image list in Rebuild Instance is constructed from (id, name)
pairs. As the name is a string, the transform function is never called
unless image name is None. In that case it crashes the view.

This change:
  - Builds the image list with (id, image) so the correct thing
      is passed to the transform
  - Corrects the size/name attributes
  - Handles None display name (displays id instead)
  - Set the name of one of the public images in glance_data.py to
      None so errors like these are picked up in the future.

Change-Id: I0d1f8594cccc404c0dd6f254b70d23789817dd06
Closes-bug: #1258349
'}]
commit_message:
Fix display of images in Rebuild Instance

The image list in Rebuild Instance is constructed from (id, name)
pairs. As the name is a string, the transform function is never called
unless image name is None. In that case it crashes the view.

This change:
  - Builds the image list with (id, image) so the correct thing
      is passed to the transform
  - Corrects the size/name attributes
  - Handles None display name (displays id instead)
  - Set the name of one of the public images in glance_data.py to
      None so errors like these are picked up in the future.

Change-Id: I0d1f8594cccc404c0dd6f254b70d23789817dd06
Closes-bug: #1258349

commit_message:
Cleanly fail when location URI is malformed

At the moment when a malformed URI is passed at either image creation
or update Glance fails with an Error 500. This commit allows Glance
to fails cleanly with a 400 BadStoreUri.

Change-Id: Iffe9be3b65758d18c7e7f96b3ceb3399b9748b63
Closes-bug: #1257498

commit_message:
Django Formset support in DataTable

Add FormsetDataTable and FormsetDataTableMixin classes that allow you
to use a Django Formset with your DataTable, making it possible to edit
the data displayed.

Implements: blueprint formset-data-table

Change-Id: I636fa3ae9847f1700eae0fb5293fa97683ba2218

subject: Change how scrollShift is calculated.

[{'created': '2013-12-06 17:48:41.000000000', 'message': "Change modals possition from js to css.

Remove the javascript code that sets the possition of the modals
that didn't work and set a 'fixes' possition attribute instead of
'absolute'

Tested in: Chrome - Firefox - IE11 - IE10 - IE9

Change-Id: Icf691eb140e091615a98f1fbd415428cd418ba9e
Closes-Bug: 1251361
"}, {'created': '2013-12-11 17:01:58.000000000', 'message': "Change how scrollShift is calculated.

    In Firefox $('body').scrollTop returns 0, that's why the modal
    appear outside the visible screen. Added $('hmtl).scrollTop.

    var scrollShift = $('body').scrollTop() || $('html').scrollTop()

    Closes-Bug: 1251361

Change-Id: Icf691eb140e091615a98f1fbd415428cd418ba9e
"}]
commit_message:
Change how scrollShift is calculated.

    In Firefox $('body').scrollTop returns 0, that's why the modal
    appear outside the visible screen. Added $('hmtl).scrollTop.

    var scrollShift = $('body').scrollTop() || $('html').scrollTop()

    Closes-Bug: 1251361

Change-Id: Icf691eb140e091615a98f1fbd415428cd418ba9e

commit_message:
Discrepancy between README.rst and cinder help

1) --version in README should be --os-volume-api-version

2) CINDER_URL should be OS_AUTH_URL

Change-Id: I409634f3025463f2ae9419ddd0d99fa50554a04d
Closes-Bug: 1251385

commit_message:
Fixes ConfigDrive bug on Windows

Files must be written specifying "wb" instead of "w"
to support binary files on both Windows and Linux.

Change-Id: I069845136df4a11b54c931a71575ca3efb9bc6d0
Closes-Bug: #1261585

commit_message:
Supports bash_completion for heatclient

bash_completion feature can improve CLI user experience, projects like
nova, keystone, and cinder already support it.

NOTE: this patch just provides simple functionality, which means cache
for IDs and names is not used (like nova).

Closes-Bug: #1260939
Change-Id: I327e884e1c5907c9ff6f31131c70aee659cca58e

[{'created': '2013-12-16 13:57:15.000000000', 'message': 'Added Tenant-Create step to Create Base Networks

As reported to Launchpad, the creation of the base networks
document expects the user to create one or more initial tenants.
Whilst this has been done in prior steps, it's not clear, or
obvious how to do it. I've added a basic one-liner and linked
to relevant supporting documents in the install-guide.

Changes also fix a minor typo and append the "--tenant-id"
parameter to the user input sections where required.

Change-Id: I8ef3d3c69a5b10a9a4906f4249da1605f9a01e4c
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: 1261165
(cherry picked from commit 5a184ab933e76100ba18b25d7fd7ed6d9767319e)
'}]
commit_message:
Added Tenant-Create step to Create Base Networks

As reported to Launchpad, the creation of the base networks
document expects the user to create one or more initial tenants.
Whilst this has been done in prior steps, it's not clear, or
obvious how to do it. I've added a basic one-liner and linked
to relevant supporting documents in the install-guide.

Changes also fix a minor typo and append the "--tenant-id"
parameter to the user input sections where required.

Change-Id: I8ef3d3c69a5b10a9a4906f4249da1605f9a01e4c
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: 1261165
(cherry picked from commit 5a184ab933e76100ba18b25d7fd7ed6d9767319e)

commit_message:
Added Neutron configuration for Nova in dedicated compute install

The installation instructions for provisioning a dedicated compute
node alongside OpenStack Networking was incomplete. It did not cover
how to configure Nova itself to communicate and make use of Neutron
networking.

Change-Id: I6e4772f5460ff84109db21c28e4edd2ff7e45d7f
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: 1260566

commit_message:
Missing LVM package install step on Ubuntu

The Cinder Block Storage service node guide was missing a
step to install the lvm2 packages. These packages needed
to be installed before the pvcreate and vgcreate steps
were initiated.

Change-Id: I7b85b962f8652667dd9df18b470430f9063a89f8
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: 1259443
(cherry picked from commit 8fe17f3e1a5358d1181df56b0f1cc63227b75666)

subject: trustee unable to perform role based operations on trust

commit_message:
trustee unable to perform role based operations on trust

There was a typo in a conditional that checked the trustor twice, instead
of trustee and trustor. The typo was preventing a trustee from being
able to list or get or check roles that were delegated.

Also, removed the spurious check of is_admin from said conditional
(_is_trustor_trustee_admin), and renamed it to _is_trustor_trustee.

An additional check, to see if a trust existed, was removed since it
was repeated unnecessarily.

Added a test to cover the gap that was discovered in the bug report.

SecurityImpact

Change-Id: Id61e71cb3ea7c6bc51783af067fbbbe4c9bffafe
Closes-Bug: 1261104

commit_message:
Useful tools for alembic usage

Added:
	ironic-dbversion - prints correct version of db
	accordignly to last migration script version

	ironic-dbrevision - automatic generation of migrations or templates for them.
	could be extended to be fully compatible with 'alembic revision' command

Change-Id: I6d4dc75c4c210d9a0ff2caabcbae05be9f4d0256

commit_message:
admin user gets ResellerAdmin role if swift is up

The ResellerAdmin roles allows a user to delete, list and create
accounts on swift.

Change-Id: Ib7a06bf8785c20f48d284363a6c6948f4d0ba0f7
Closes-Bug: #1231870

- check-swift-devstack-vm-functional http://logs.openstack.org/50/53150/1/check/check-swift-devstack-vm-functional/59fc0cc : SUCCESS in 10m 32s
'}, {'account_id': 8122, 'date': '2013-10-25 15:00:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8122, 'date': '2013-10-25 15:06:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@David Peraza: sure, I'll explain a bit more.

This main issue is that we currently have one central agent that has to do all the polling work. In a near future, we'd like to be able to distribute the work onto many central agents (as discussed with Mehdi). We'd like to say "well, this central agent should poll the samples with thse resource ids, this other agent should take care of samples with these resource ids, etc".

So we'll need to add a 'resource_id' field to the get_samples() method (note that this could be something else than an ID: a URL, for instance). We'll also need to gather all 'ids'.

A first step would be to keep a single agent and have it do:

for id in pollster.get_resources(): pollster.get_samples(..., id)

This way, we would not change the existing behaviour, and still have the needed infrastructure to move to a multi-agent model.'}, {'account_id': 5313, 'date': '2013-10-25 15:27:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Thanks it makes sense, id seems to be enough yes, it is just a matter of dividing the work.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-10-25 15:33:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Add a get_resources() method to the pollsters

This is a first step towards improving the central agent so that we can run
multiple ones at once while keeping the same behaviour.

This is a first step towards implementing the
task-distribution-for-central-agents blueprint. Then, we'll need to add an 'id'
parameter to the pollsters' get_samples() methods, which will allow us to
distribute polling tasks to a central agent.

Blueprint: task-distribution-for-central-agents
Change-Id: Ia9d3d3c4f667671d55ac31ad38a180a069b65140

commit_message:
Bug: horizon is removing the URL path from glance's endpoint

Autor: Raildo Mascena <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Glanceclient removes the API version from the endpoint in case it exists. Look the following code:

https://github.com/openstack/python-glanceclient/blob/master/glanceclient/shell.py#L310

The rest of code includes the API version in use accordingly.

Closes-Bug: #1188182

Change-Id: I0e73d7d9241dec9be07bfd6fd643642bad486aa8

(3 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2013-11-26 01:57:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

To explain a little better. 

There are 3 parts to keystoneclient that are related but need to be treated individually. 

- Client code: the main usage of which should be considered as importing the client from other python applications. This needs to be predictable and work consistently (which adding a find to the get() violates)

- Middleware: Will go into the pipeline of other services and abstracts the complexity for dealing with keystone's tokens and such.

- Shell: The CLI, has been deprecated in favour of the common openstack client and so will only ever support v2. It is _one_ user of the client but if you need to make changes specifically to the command line it needs to be isolated to here."}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-11-26 09:54:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Jamie, so the obvious place would be the shell here but since it is deprecated would that be worthwhile to still try to submit it there?'}, {'account_id': 9311, 'date': '2013-11-26 10:23:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Hi Jamie, thanks for reviewing this change.

I misread the client code path, it is keystoneclient.utils.find_resource() that tries to get() and fallback to find().
You are right, a get() shouldn't issue a find() then.

This find_resource is also present in openstackclient and I think it should be improved to avoid issuing get(user_name)."}, {'account_id': 9311, 'date': '2013-11-26 12:03:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-11-26 12:47:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me
